Title: Grand Hotel Courmayeur is definitely Grand!
Text: We stayed at the the Grand Hotel Courmayeur Mont Blanc for 4 nights while hiking the TMB.  This hotel was a welcome respite after a day on the trail.  It is a beautiful hotel with spacious and comfortable rooms.  The staff were incredibly helpful from making recommendations for restaurants to the shuttle service they provided.  It started with reception personally escorting us to our room.  We appreciated the shuttle service, especially driver Andrea (sp?) who took us wherever we needed to go.  We were particularly impressed with Nando, one of the managers, who took the time to sit and talk with us about the hotel, the area and the culture.  He helped us make some decisions that enhanced our experience.

Title: Amazing hotel and tremendous staff!
Text: Stupendous hotel! Beautiful lobby, restaurant, bar, and rooms. The smell when you walk into the lobby is heavenly! One of the managers, Nando, was so friendly and helpful! He helped us when we were torn about our TMB hike on a rainy day, he gave us wonderful advice and we ended up having a wonderful hike despite the rain. The front desk staff recommended amazing local restaurants and made our reservations and we took the hotel shuttle to and from. The bar staff is fantastic, very friendly and knowledgeable. We did not want to leave this hotel! We hope to get back here someday.

Title: Exceptional stay in Courmayeur
Text: We had an amazing stay at the Hotel Grand Courmayeur in the middle of our Tour du Mont Blanc. Our room was beautiful and we very well attended throughout our stay. The shuttle service offered was invaluable, and their recommendations for dinner were perfect. We enjoyed the restaurant and bar in the hotel as well, and received consistently great service. It was a fantastic place to recharge for the second half of the TMB.

Title: Great stay at Grand Hotel, Courmayeur
Text:
We arrived for a 3 nights stay at the hotel, and found what we were expecting, and much more. Hotel location very comfortable, and the shuttle to nearby attractions saved us a lot of time. The rooms with the mountains view were clean, large enough, and modern. The hotel overall is very modern.
Breakfast served every morning in the dining room facing the remarkable Mont Blanc view.
Anything you had in mind, was served in Breakfast.
The Staff is very helpful, for any inquiry or help needed.
Would like to specify front desk reps, 
Ms. Greta and Christian for their service oriented attitude.
BR, Haim.

Title: Highly recommended, excellent hotel
Text: I highly recommend the hotel: the rooms are pleasant and beautifully designed, the location is excellent, the breakfast is indulgent, the view is breathtaking, and the staff is kind and caring, doing everything to make the stay at the hotel and in the city enjoyable, giving precise recommendations—where to eat, sites in the area, etc. I'm sure we'll be back.

Title: Mountain view, excellent service, super facilities and great location
Text: Spent four night on this beautiful hotel, in a room w fantastic Mountain View. Excellent  service in all functions - reception, spa, restaurants, parking etc - very kind and super professional. Great location In  Courmayeur. We’ve been there three times before, summer and winter, and will for sure choose this hotel again.

Title: Poor food
Text: Beautiful views and great location on the edge of Courmayeur. Shuttle service from the hotel in and out of town is really useful. The rooms are a good size and have a good sized balcony. That's the good part. The food is shockingly poor for any hotel let alone 5 star. Breakfast was a minimal choice, and the hot selections were cold. If you asked for fresh hot food they put it through a microwave. Really not acceptable. This is a very expensive hotel and I had hoped for more.

Title: A few nights in Courmayeur.
Text: This hotel was the most amazing respite from our TMB hike. The rooms were gorgeous and the beds incredible comfortable. The spa was beautiful and very well appointed. There was nothing I could say negatively about this hotel. The staff was incredibly attentive and the breakfast was A Plus!

Title: One of the best accommodations, if not the best, of our 5 week Italy trip.
Text: We really loved our stay at the Grand Hotel Courmayeur. In our view, although the facility was beautiful, the attentive and helpful staff made our visit very memorable. All of the staff were extremely courteous and I wish I had everyone’s name to mention here, especially those at the front desk. Nando and Alessandro  were especially friendly and helpful. Many of the staff recognized us in town on their off hours and greeted us. As far as other aspects, breakfast was outstanding, served in a room that overlooked the mountains. Pretty much anything you asked for could be had. A beautiful lounge was available to relax, also with a great view. Everything was absolutely spotless including our room and bathroom. I will say that if you prefer a more historic feel, you might be disappointed, but we found the modern decor tasteful and inventive. If available, try and get a room in the B or C buildings, which I think might have better views and be a bit quieter than Bldg A. Be prepared, there is no A/C. It was fairly comfortable in our room while we were there, but only with our balcony door open, which meant the room could be noisy with early morning auto and construction noise. Lastly, the included spa amenities such as the heated pool, steam and sauna, and aromatic showers were a nice touch. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Title: Amazing stay
Text: We spent 3 nights with friends. Place is beautiful. Staff incredible. Rooms are clean, breakfast so good, plenty of food. Nando the manager, Alessandro and Wiam so kind with us. For sure we’ll be back in the winter season with some other friends.

Title: Truly a Great Stay
Text: We booked here last minute after walking the Tour De Mont Blanc. The staff went out of their way to make everyone comfortable, recommended a great local restaurant and welcomed us. The rooms are very comfortable, amazing bath/shower, quiet and decorated in an elevated way to suit this spectacular town.

Title: Courmayeur's newest and best hotel!
Text: I've been to Grand Hotel twice this month to escape Milan's hot summer days. The property is a modern 5 star with beautiful rooms with a spacious balcony. Bathrooms have a giant bathtub, open shower and lots of space. I also had a walk in closet with a coffee machine and complimentary water. The spa area is beautiful and they have Cinq Mondes products which are my favorite. Pool and sauna area are brand new and very well designed. Nando, the Chief of Reception is an absolute rockstar helping guests and really suggesting them ideas to optimise their stay. I also had a beautiful dinner at La Fourchette. Breakfast is unbelievable too: freshly made mountain butter, bread are made in house soo. A collection of fruit jams awaits you... not to forget cakes, pastries, cheese, pancakes with real maple syrup, egg, bacon etc.  An outstanding hotel that deserves not less than a 5 stars rating!

Title: An amazing stay from start to finish
Text:
The hotel from start to finish was a great experience, from the front desk staff to the spa team nothing was too much trouble. 

Nando was great in welcoming us almost like we were family and the whole experience was amazing! 

I will definitely look to come here again for ski season and would have no issues recommending this hotel as the place to stay when visiting Courmayeur!

Title: Luxury mountain escape
Text: Wonderfully located hotel in beautiful Courmayeur. Hotel facilities were great, we enjoyed the spa and rooms were specious and well equipped. Nando was a brilliant host and the staff helped us book a lovely restaurant in town for dinner. Will definitely come back in the ski season to check it out!

Title: Disappointing
Text:
We travel to Courmayeur monthly and thought to give this 5* beautifully looking hotel a try. 

However, it could hardly pass for a 4*.

First massive let down - air conditioning. I understand that we are in a mountain region and temperatures are cooler for most of the year but summers in Courmayeur are pretty warm and a 5* hotel with no AC is not acceptable. In our instance we had 25 degrees celcius theoughout our trip and room temperature was getting over 26 which is far from a comfortable night’s sleep, especially when you’re travelling with a 1 year old and are unable to close the windows to prevent outdoor noise for day naps and night’s sleep. 

Gym is a sauna for the same reason and totally unusable if you’re looking to do cardio. 

Reception standards definitely don’t stand a chance of a 5* hotel. Having asked some information about the spa I was told to go in the room and call them myself. Also, on the morning of our check-out we were not even asked if we need help with our bags when we came downstairs with full hands + a toddler. 

On the positive note, they offer a great breakfast selection and the breakfast staff are quite attentive. 

Overall quite disappointing as it is a beautiful hotel in an amazing location but the service definitely doesn’t stand a chance of 5*.

Title: Excellent!!!!
Text:
The Grand Hotel Courmayeur is truly a gem in Mont Blanc. Located in the most stunning spot with a direct view of the breathtaking Mont Blanc, this hotel offers a warm and welcoming atmosphere from the moment you arrive. The staff goes above and beyond to ensure your comfort, providing complimentary drinks, chocolates, and cookies upon arrival.

The rooms are beautifully decorated in a nature-inspired style and come equipped with all the amenities you could need, including coffee, water, and snacks. The dining room staff are incredibly generous and accommodating, even staying open late to ensure you have a meal.

Nando, the front desk manager, is a true professional who goes out of his way to make sure your stay is unforgettable. The value for money at this hotel is outstanding, making it a highly recommended choice for your next stay in Courmayeur. Thank you to the amazing team at the Grand Hotel Courmayeur for a wonderful experience. #LuxuryTravel #GrandHotelCourmayeur #MontBlancView.

Title: Stunning views, friendly hospitality
Text: This is our second stay at GHCMB. It's a top notch property with clean design and stunning views of the Mont Blanc. Everyone is super nice: reception desk, restaurant staff, drivers of the shuttle, the spa team. We had to leave early in the morning for our kids’ ice skating lessons and the breakfast staff was always helpful and accommodating. If you travel with small kids a fantastic public playground is immediately next to the hotel

Title: Best view in the Alps!
Text:
What a lovely hotel!! We loved everything about this place from the ambience to the service. The hotel staff is excellent especially Nadio. The view from our room of Mont Blanc is absolutely stunning!!
We will be back here!!
The town of courmayeur is so charming.
The shops, restaurants and architecture is amazing.

Title: What a gem!
Text: What a gem! I spent a night in that beautiful hotel on the Montblanc. I booked over the phone and received a perfect service. Upon arrival, a valet parked my car, the reception did a quick and efficient check in and brought me to my room. My room was spotless, brand new with a stunning view on the mountain. Their pool area is amazing. Breakfast was very well presented and displayed quality products. Staff was smiling and extremely kind. What to say, this hotel is the gem of Courmayeur. It's modern, brand new and to me the best option one can choose.

Title: Perfect place in beautiful venue!
Text:
Excellent hotel,
Very friendly and welcoming staff and manager, will definitely come back in the winter season.
Loved the design, food and neatness of the hotel. View on the mountains is marvellous too.
Walking distance from shops and restaurants, excellent parking facilities.

Title: My stay at The Grand Hotel in Courmayeur
Text:
Recently I went to The Grand Hotel in Courmayeur. It was pretty good for a 5 star hotel and I would keep it that way but some of the staff were slightly rude (but some were very kind).
Let’s start with a bit of the positives like the spa. The spa was amazing! There is a big swimming pool but it isn’t cold it is a hot swimming pool. Also there is an Experience Shower behind the pool and sauna aswell. There is a good gym but very cramped.
The room that I stayed in was a beautiful two story room with two beds ,one upstairs and one downstairs. It had a spacious bathroom with a big bathtub in the corner.
Moving on to the food! The breakfast was very nice except there was no toaster so I could not have my usual toast for breakfast. I didn’t have lunch here since I went skiing up in the mountains, but dinner was nice and peaceful. My family and I got served really quickly as not many people were there.
Let’s move onto some of the negatives. The two men that drove us to the ski lift and to a restaurant were really rude and complaining to the hotel about why they had to drive us. As far as I am aware of, if you speak English not Italian you are going to have a tough time as they can’t speak a good amount of English. Also the shuttle is really slow to pick you up.
The ski lift is not far away from the hotel. It is a 5 minute drive away and a 15 minute walk away from it. Lots of nice places in Courmayeur but I would not recommend this place to English people as they cannot understand you very well.

Title: Disrespectful Manager could make the trip really memorable
Text: We paid over 300 dollar/night for a room but we were given a room which had a view of someone's backyard and a playground. The room also had no AC.  The room was hot and humid. The room was also noisy as children were playing all the time next door. Being orbitz platinum we requested a room upgrade or same room with a nicer view. The front desk staff were really nice and wanted to do the upgrade as there were availabilities. Next morning during the breakfast time we also noticed the whole breakfast area was empty. The manager refused the room change without any logic or reason. Certainly the person has issues or has no respect for clients. The hotel group should be aware of this type of managers who brings no good to the business. I have been traveling to italy for last 16 years, and this is the worst hotel management I have ever seen. The manager was so disrespectful, even refused to talk to us personally. The room was so awful and experience was so bad that we decided to leave the hotel and accept the loss before actual check out date.  Also, just want to let the audience know that Mont Blanc tunnel always has issues, and it takes 55 euro to cross the tunnel. Please plan accordingly if you plan to visit french side. Thanks to all excellent staff of the hotel except the manager.

Title: disappointed
Text: Recently attend a company weekend to which I can only express dissatisfaction with this hotel for creating a memorable experience for everything but a good experience. From rooms with not coffee machine, lacking water pressure in the showers and neighboring rooms being able to hear your every discussion with your partner to broken locks on common toilets. Breakfast lacked enthusiasm with no freshly baked breads and sausages steamed so long that they were good enough to be left on the plate. We hoped for a great dinner with a set menu where meals had to be selected a day before. Unfortunately the dining staff failed the hotel with confusion from the start, this resulted in worst possible experience Courmayeur could offer. For the vegetarians out there... you have fish and potato rosti with ham... mmm??? cannot fault the massage but unfortunately could hear every weight being lifted or splash in the pool... if you are looking for a 5 star experience - LOOK ELSWHERE... if you want to experience 3 star (or at best a 4 star) and pay the prices of a 5 star... then go try. For us, this is the last time ever to visit the Grand Hotel Courmayeur.

Title: Excellent stay at Grand Hotel Courmayeur.
Text: We have just had a fabulous stay at the Grand Hotel. The food, the staff, the hospitality and our shuttle driver were all 5* . Nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were beautiful and clean and towels were changed daily. Could not fault it and endeavour to return. Thank you to all 🥰

Title: 5 stars on paper - not value for big money
Text:
This hotel is nice at first sight, but during the stay you will see that there a lot of things broken like lamps, ski storage room was out of order, sauna/spa needs renovation, toalett doors broken. When you ask something at reception, sounds like nothing is arrangeable. 
Stay here costed 650 eur/night and compared to other 5 star hotel (like W in Verbier) this is far far lower level. 
When asking something at reception, the receptionist goes always to boss room asking (I never saw this boss) and answer to everything is always no - or yes but this thos extra cost (well…. See the price of stay 650 eur/night). 
If you’re looking for a posh hotel, this is not. Go elsewhere.

Title: Very enjoyable experience. Truly 5 star care.
Text:
Good sized rooms. Well provided. Sensible bathroom. Comfortable bed. Very attentive & helpful employees. Only small downside was under whelming breakfast.  Location is a short way out of the centre, but local transfers are quickly available. Dog friendly. 
Covered valet parking.

Title: Not even close…
Text:
Our family stayed in a suite for a week and were out of hot water everyday, NO explanation and NO compensation offered. Paid 450 Euro pp for new years eve gala dinner which included wine for adults but only water for kids….Allergies not noted. The food was average

Asked for a compensation but was told the manager would contact me, he never did

The staff at breakfast was unfriendly and very slow. All in all not even close to the service level to be expected from a five star hotel. So not worth the prices charged. There are definitely better options in Courmayeur

Title: Meh- much better options available than this - from a Marriott Ambassador
Text:
Tough to say this is a good hotel. It’s adequate- but don’t spend anything extra to stay here. I’m Marriott Ambassador and Hilton Diamond and Hyatt highest level. So I stay in hotels a lot. This hotel to me is labeled as a high end hotel but 2star at best service and facilities. You may want to reconsider your choice of staying here - I’m here now and definitely feel I should have stayed elsewhere. Believe it or not - staff is actually amazing! Bar tenders on 2nd floor are beyond competent and great. But that where it ends. I got USED toiletries from the prior guest - shame on you! - and my room wasn’t clean - previous guest’s long hair everywhere. It was obvious they hadn’t cleaned the room - maybe they swept it (if that!) I asked for new toiletries and the front deck woman who was super nice and pleasant just didn’t get me. 

Overall - overrated for the price, better options if you want good clean rooms! I had to clean my room with Clorox wipes - tells you everything you need to know

Title: 11 year anniversary
Text:
I just arrived home and was excited to write this review. This hotel is truly special . The price is very good , the staff were excellent ,super friendly and knowledgeable and I didn’t even get to the accommodations yet . The hotel is filled with beautiful antiques , top level fashion and a gorgeous pool, spa , heated outdoor pool, sauna Etc I’m missing being there already .

I am a very busy man and had only 48hrs to enjoy my 11th year anniversary with my wife and being there made us feel as though we were there for 5 days . I highly recommend and will be back very very soon .

Title: Sad, tired, dingy hotel with incredibly rude staff
Text: We arrived in Courmayeur, and we were enchanted by our surroundings. The mountain vistas are breathtakingly beautiful.  Then we got to our hotel. It was well placed, and in it's heyday it must have been a beautiful hotel. Now it's a crumbling old relic, managed by a grumpy cadre of staff. The woman at the reception was dismissive, unhelpful and rude.  Missing bulbs, dusty bedcovers, banged up floors, shutters and windows that don't lock properly from wear and tear. It's a mess! Breakfast was a disaster. It was extremely basic and sad.

Title: Great friendly service and spacious modern rooms
Text: Stayed here as a group and all our needs were met.  Reception staff were efficient, helpful and friendly.  Rooms are spacious modern and very clean.  Breakfasts are fantastic with so much choice and staff always on hand for anything you needed.   The hotel is a short walk from the centre and therefore away from the hustle and bustle.    A wonderful team of staff throughout the hotel.   We had a great stay.   Thank you so much.

Title: Excellent Service and Staff and Super flexible management given recent restrictions
Text: I cannot praise this hotel for making the impossible possible given the uncertainty we have all suffered with the recent and continuing changing regulations on travel and entry requirements. The hotel were prepared to give us maximum flexility for a very large booking coming from different destinations, each with different government advice . Had this not been the case, we would have had to cancel our reservation 2 months before. As a result we all confirmed and had the most fantastic 7 days at this hotel. Thank you .

Title: A total failure of service and basic facilities......THIS IS NOT A 5 STAR HOTEL!!!!!!!
Text:
Before I get started, I have to say that I have reviewed many hotels and restaurants all over the world and I have never stayed anywhere where the level of service and basic facilities was as disappointing and frankly, misleading. We are contacting the Italian Tourist Board to try to ascertain their justification for awarding this place with the rating it professes to have. Booked as a last ditch attempt to get away for a ski holiday when our plans to ski in France were ended by the new French restrictions. How I wish the french had never done that....
In all fairness, we should have smelt a massive rat when they had availability and virtually every other place in Courmayeur was full but we were desperate to get away and we've all been there haven't we? Reservations (Alex) very keen to please and found us a suite for 3 people. Curiously, he said there were no doubles left so we were curious (but really happy) when our friends managed to book 3 doubles the next day....hmmmmm
The building itself is great, overlooking the top end of the village and has great views out over the mountains. We checked in and the alarm bells instantly started jangling. The decor gives off a bland, international, anodyne vibe, acres of white corridors, out of place cheap artwork, dotted with glass cabinetry showcasing primary coloured fur jackets. The rooms have a curious 'that will do' air to them, decorated in a bare, 'not quite finished' style with little or no consideration to comfort or style. Phots all show the beds with a pleasant enough patterned wool blanket draped over them. This blanket is the only concession to any form of decor in the rooms. Bear in mind here we are commenting on the basis that their prices are stratospheric and they claim to be a 5 star hotel.....) The TV's don't work (we were told this was 'because of the weather), there is no bottled water in the rooms (despite asking virtually daily we received nothing except what was in the mini bar which was never replenished - in the end we gave up and went to the village to buy it) Brown water came out of the taps, the hot water ran out on a couple of nights, the heating was permanently jammed on 24* and when we called to ask them to come and see to it, we were told to 'open the windows' - which we couldn't as we were on the ground floor and the windows in question were french doors. No proper storage bar one hanging rail and the 'bed' for our daughter was a pull down sofa which she still has backache from sleeping on - the metal parts stuck out everywhere and the mattress was so thin you could fold it up. Nowhere to hang wet ski clothes. Reception was utterly contemptuous. From checking in to the moment we left, not one single person cracked a smile, asked us if our stay was going well or tried to assist with anything. We were permanently treated as if we had inconvenienced them, a particular low point was asking if the concierge (there actually isn't one) could assist us with some restaurant bookings, the girl in question threw us an incredulous look and told us to 'do it ourselves', they wanted deposits for umbrellas when it was pouring, the ski lockers (?!), which, incidentally we didn't get back, there was no information in the room on anything including room service so we were told 'go to the bar then and order it there'..... and so it went on. Catering was a hoot, the breakfast service was like a scene from a Carry On film, possibly called Carry On Chaos.... we had to ask several times each morning for hot drinks, short order food etc. No one had a clue what was going on, the food was extremely average. Fruit mostly tinned, pastries tired, one morning I asked for 2 boiled eggs and was served 9 eggs, 5 in a bowl from the buffet by someone who looked like she wanted to fling them at me, then another 4 in 2 lots from the clearly under siege kitchen. The bar has the atmosphere of a dentists waiting room and getting a drink was torture, it took at best about 10 minutes for anyone to even acknowledge you were waiting. Didn't eat in the restaurant so can't comment but it was empty most evenings. Room service food on New Years Day was off the charts awful, incorrect, cold and frankly, disgraceful. When we checked out, my husband drew a line through all the charges for food, mini bar water etc  and paid only the bar bill and they didn't flinch - that, my friends, is how used to it the staff are. The shuttle service was ok but again, manned by a chap whose manner and attitude was one of utter contempt. There is a strange chap who hangs around reception, clearly part of the show but not dressed in a hotel uniform who drives one of the vehicles etc and one morning, my friend and I were waiting to get a lift to the main lifts and started chatting to him. We'd been waiting about 20 minutes and a couple walked out of reception and headed into his van and when we asked if he was taking us as well, he refused and said 'these are my clients' With that, the main van driver pitched up and an exchange took place between the two of them which clearly went a bit like this 'You have to take these two to the lifts' 'No chance get lost, I'm not doing it , you do it', at which point the first van sped off with the 'clients' inside it and the other driver disappeared inside (coffee anyone?) - we went to reception after about 10 minutes and made our feelings felt and he appeared, was a lot politer and even carried our skiis!!!! But hey, what a massive effort, and all, remember, in a 5 STAR HOTEL......
There is a small spa and it was full on the afternoons I went of young couples snogging in the pool - yeuchhh.
No idea what Mythos Group think they are doing here but if you check the reviews they get very poor from a couple of years ago onwards. The place is being run not for the guests but with a very keen eye on the bottom line and there is clearly no or very poor training given to the staff plus there is a fundamental breakdown of management. Plus they all clearly hate their jobs so someone somewhere is doing something very wrong. Spend your money on the Massif or one of the really nice looking 3 and 4 star places, but please do not stay here, we honestly felt like we'd been mugged when we left. None of this review is malicious in any way, just the plain truth and motivated by a feeling of utter injustice at a place that markets itself as something it isn't and gives not one jot of the way it abuses its guests with its lack of service. Pure theft.

Title: Adrian Collins
Text:
Stayed at the hotel over new year 2021/2022 - just got back. We had booked for France but then the french banned UK tourists. We already had flights to Geneva so looked for alternatives and found availability here. There were 5 in my family and we booked 3 rooms at an eye-watering cost for 7 nights - 3 rooms cost us €16,000. Because of the pandemic we hadn’t been away for 2 years so decided to splash out for a xmas ski trip. Despite it being billed as a 5-star hotel the service was way below that standard and what we’ve experienced in other 5 star hotels. 
The room service was truly awful and the quality of the food delivered ghastly. 
There were no tea and coffee facilities in the rooms, no complimentary water - you had to buy it via the mini bar, not even an iron and ironing board (you had to use the laundry service if you wanted to press a shirt before dinner). 
Rooms felt unfinished - nowhere to hang coats, the wet room flooded because the floor tiles didn’t drain properly, we had to pay a deposit to use the ski lockers!! We didn’t eat dinner in the restaurant as we’d booked local restaurants most evenings so only had breakfast. It was ok but certainly not 5 star quality. The service was shockingly poor. Sometimes had to order coffee/tea several times before it was delivered and the same for the a la carte breakfast menu. 
The bar on the 1st floor was badly staffed and on two occasions we gave up waiting for the bar staff to make an appearance. 
No concierge service! Staff generally unfriendly. 
This felt very much like an amateur operation where customer service was pretty low down the list of priorities. 
Would definitely never stay at the Grand again and the Mythos group of hotels of which this forms part I’d avoid like the plague. 
Our of the whole week, met only one well trained member of staff, Matteo, the waiter who was delightful.

Title: Fabulous wedding weekend
Text:
We decided to have our wedding (ceremony and party) at Grandhotel Courmayeur Mont Blanc and I confirm we could not have chosen a better place. Everything was simply perfect!
Even in Covid times, we were supported and helped in each step of the preparation, we woundn't have managed without Alessandro, super thanks!  
Then the day of arrived and everything was exactly the way we were dreaming about!
The venue was stunning, the food amazing, the people super nice and helpful.
All all our guests fell in love with the place and had a great time!
Some of us stayed at the hotel for some extra days and the rooms were splendid: spacious, clean and with modern decoration.
Thank you all for making our day special!

Title: Very nice hotel with modern design
Text:
Instayed one night in late July. Great experience. Personnel is very nice at reception and at the bar. 
For a mountain hotel the modern design is quite impressive and even the Spa is great. 
We had lunch at the hotel not this time but another time and the food qas really high quality.

Title: Not a good experience
Text: Poor room, we didn’t get a suite but we paid 990€ for one WE. It has a very limited cupboard: small and long like tunnel, you hardly reach the hangers at the back. Not one single wall hanger or shelf in the room (just two hangers in the bathroom for the bathrobes). Where are you supposed to hang your ski clothes and place your ski stuff? Basic decoration and furniture. Quite uncomfortable as you to leave your luggage in the floor at the long entrance because the room just has one small bench  for one trolley and one small chair which you have to use to put all your ski clothes as they do not fit in the cupboard (specially if you have non skiing coats). Very nice staff and willing to help but this does not compensate the lack of comfort. In addition, there was a big company event: very young people not behaving at the spa (drinking cognac in the steam bath, laughing very laud and making fun at the sauna..., zero relax). At night laughters and lack of silence. Maybe we are used to a higher quality for a 5 star hotel.

Title: Just perfect
Text: This is a really nice hotel nicely located in Courmayeur. Very attentive staff everywhere, in the front desk, cleaning, breakfast, spa and transport. We really enjoyed our stay here, and especially the transport service to the ski areas, city center etc. Very clean and well equipped rooms. Good selection for breakfast including freshly squeezed orange juice and very tasteful coffee. Looking forward to coming back next year.

Title: Very Disappointed
Text:
Please note prior to reading this, my views are expressed on the understanding this is a 5 star hotel and am only comparing to the various other 5 star hotels I have stayed in over the years.

Duration: So, we were travelling as a family of 4 and our nanny for a week over what was initially planned to be after Christmas until after New Years Eve 2020.

Arrival: Upon arrival at the hotel, there was no-one for the suitcases, until I went inside and ask for assistance. Eventually the bell-hop came out and took the cases, I then proceeded to go into what appeared a cold hotel, with very interesting tacky-looking decor, in what does actually appear to be modern hotel, just whomever did the interior needs very serious advice. I then proceeded to the reception desk, where I was greeted by a gentleman that had been dealing with my booking, in fairness he tried to be helpful and polite, but the general mood of him and his staff next to him, was miserable. My wife, a few steps behind me on her way in, said hello, but there was no response. Even then it is not her responsibility to initiate a greeting upon entry to a hotel, it should be the other way around. Moving on.... Eventually we got our room keys, I had also requested keys for the ski locker and to my amazement I was asked to pay a deposit for the keys, as although the lockers are in the hotel, they are not owned by the hotel. For a 5 star hotel, they sure don't trust their guests. 1/5

Room: On the face of it the rooms are very nice, well designed and proportioned, spacious, clean, we had a great view of the mountains. Well stocked minibar and nice toiletries. My wife wasn't too happy about the lack of a shower-screen, but this was due to it being a wet shower and in the end wasn't too much of an issue as our bathroom was spacious. The toilet however was out in the open in the bathroom, with just a glass screen separating it and an inadequate extraction system. 4/5

Spa & Pool Facilities: Unfortunately, due to our stay being cut short, we didn't get to experience any of the Spa or Pool facilities, although they do have a cut off period for kids in the pool during the winter season, inconveniently right about the time the kids would usually use the pool between 4pm to 6pm. -/5

Shuttle Service: DO Not bother with this facility, if you make the mistake of booking at this hotel, ensure you get the number of the local taxi company. You might pay, but at leats you won't wait around in the freezing cold for no-one to turn up. Very very disorganised, and they tell fibs that the car is on its way, when clearly i's not. You have been warned. 1/5

Restaurant & Room Service: The breakfast was nice, staff were relatively miserable again, but somewhat attentive. The only fresh juice is orange juice, understandable, but maybe the grapefruit could have been fresh too? The pastries were nice, but I doubt they were made in their kitchen. Lunch in the hotel is acceptable although the menu is somewhat limited, primarily pasta and baguettes with the odd salad thrown in. Printed in-house and laminated, classy. Beware of the hairs, twice hairs were found in our meal, which thankfully were quickly replaced for the non-hair option. Please also note, dogs are permitted in the eating areas, so don't be surprised when you see them sitting on the chairs or moping around on the floor. The view of the mountains is nice however. On the last night we had dinner in their restaurant upstairs, La Forchette, i think it was called. So we arrived, and i requested a table for 4, i was told that as we did not have a reservation, that they could not seat us, I threw a little huff and puff and eventually got to choose which table we wanted, in all fairness that gentleman that was on the receiving end of my huff and puff was very likeable and I could see he tried to help. In fact when I asked for a glass of champagne, he offered me a bottle to make up for all the other issues we had encountered. Unfortunately, they continued into the meal. Firstly, my wife potatoes were frozen inside, and the meat was red-bloody-raw when it was supposed to be very well-done. Whilst she had her main I had my starter, she was then having her tea whilst my kids were having their dessert, and my main still hadn't arrived. By the time it did, I noticed the chef has decided to prepare my meal differently from what hers was, the steak was cut differently and the potatoes too, additionally the steak was raw when i had requested well-done. Very strange. Anyway, we complained and quite correctly both steaks were removed from the bill. 1/5

Housekeeping: So basically the morning housekeeping and turn-down are a bit miss-mash, usually the morning was ok, but they don't really tidy the room, only make the beds and empty the bins. We had a mug of tea sat on the coffee table for 2 days without it being removed. Turn-down is also a bit strange, they have these grubby rugs and pillows they throw onto the bed when making them in the morning and then proceed to leave them on after turn-down. These things have probably never been washed and are also littered with hairs. Maybe dog hairs?? 2/5

Summary: I would definitely not stay here again under its current management, even for free. The staff on the whole look and act miserable, very rarely do you receive a smile. That should be standard in any hotel, let alone a 5 star. Additionally, what these people don't seem to understand, is whether the customer is right or wrong, he is always right and you have to act like it. We went for dinner twice to a competitor hotel Le Massif and WOW that hotel knew what a 5 star hotel is, maybe we felt it more due to all the misery. From the moment you enter there are people looking to help you, with a smile and knowledge, added to the fact they speak English. They knew service. On the bright side, we cut our trip short by 4 days, and were back home for New Years Eve, and we weren't charged. Yes, this hotel did ruin our holiday this year, but to be honest, I did read various reviews beforehand and the concerns I had did indeed come true. That is why I have posted this review, to allow you to not make the same mistake and decide if what I have written would affect you. PS To the management who will no doubt read this, please please please send you staff undercover to Le Massif to have a look at how a true 5 star should be run. Good Luck.

Total : 2/5

Title: Not a real 5-Stars.
Text: The Grand was a bit underwhelming.. On the positive side, the location and the view were good, and importantly the general manager Alessandro was very attentive and responsive to customer needs. However this place has some work to do on several fronts. To start with, the bar area is minuscule and is juxtaposed to the breakfast area. A 5-star hotel needs to have a proper bar, like is the case with Golf Hôtel, which is further down in the village. Importantly the staff is very amateurish, not knowledgeable and lacks pro-active ness. For rates of €800/night one would expect much a more professional slate. Last but not least, the restaurant La Fourchette is very average in terms of cuisine and service whilst over-priced.

Title: Amazing hotel, 5 stars are not enough!
Text:
I stayed at this hotel for long weekend in a Junior Suite, offered as upgrade for free.
The hotel is beautiful, clean, amazing.
Staff is nice and service is impeccable from any point of view.
The spa is amazing and the breakfast is excellent.
Full luxury.
I recommend this hotel for couples and families, you can’t ask more.

Title: Not 5 star hotel
Text:
I stayed in this hotel for 5 days  .The building is modern , but not nice . Since i arrived i felt  regret to had booked the hotel . Awful and cold lobby .
It's out of town , you have to walk at least 10 minutes freezing or wait for the complimentary shuttle ( after 6 pm , they change , for the shuttle ) . One day we requested the shuttle to pick us up after the sky , and they forgot . We waited for more than 30 min and had to call the hotel . Nobody was coming , they forgot our request .Find a taxi in this city is a nightmare , so you need the shuttle .We booked a suite for 800 euros , very simple and the view not special , not really comfortable . The front desk staff is Concierge as well , for sure doesn't work . So you have to find everything by yourself .The night in this hotel is depressing , you have to walk to the city . The bar and restaurant are not  Better go to the town .The spa and fitness , ok . My friend stayed at the Golf hotel , hundred times better , located in the main street , with a nice garden with heaters during the happy hour , nice restaurant . The service is 3 stars hotel as well . The hotel manager must have to go to Cristallo Hotel in Cortina D Ampezzo , to know what means a 5 star property and service .Stay in another hotel .There are many at the city center , less expensive and better for sure .

Title: I think this hotel is a sampling of what paradise looks like
Text:
My wife and I booked this hotel just by chance and did not hesitate extending our stay.  Having traveled to more than 50 countries and hundreds of hotels, this hotel rates as the number One.  Everything has been perfect, the reception, fulfillment of special wishes (they only practice “yes”), the breakfast, the hotel upkeep, the rooms, the views (absolutely magnificent).  
All staff members have been Great.  Our experience with Marina Coco (I think she is part of the management) and Azeri Loris at reception in the evening were simply perfect.  Congratulations on the training program they undertake.
A Wonderful experience and one we will come back to very soon.

Title: Service-minded staff who ensures a good experience
Text: The hotel is bestowed with a service-minded staff, who ensures a great atmosphere and are always ready to give guests a good experience. The hotel itself is an architectural beauty, with a beautiful lobby bar on the first floor, which has a stunning view of the Mont Blanc. There is an even more beautiful restaurant on the second floor that serves delicious food with a fine selection of regional wines, which you cannot miss. The rooms have unique designs, and they are clean as a whistle. Special thanks' to Marina and co. for ensuring me a wonderful stay, and really making me feel at home in my solitude. I would come back to Courmayeur only to stay at this wonderful hotel. Highly recommended.

Title: Nice hotel but not 5*
Text:
Stayed here for 2 nights a couple of weeks ago.  My first impression was that the hotel was nice and modern.  It is a little out of town however, so a walk to any restaurants & bars.  The hotel do operate a complimentary and regular bus shuttle which takes you to both sets of cable cars up to the top of the mountain which i found very efficient.  I called the hotel one day on my way back down the mountain and they were there ready to collect me!
Our room was perfectly comfortable with a nice balcony and plenty of storage (i hate having to leave a suitcase on display and the wardrobe was deep enough for this).  We did have trouble keeping the shower hot enough though and from speaking to friends also in the hotel they too had the same problem.  Housekeeping was perhaps not quite as good as what I would expect from a 5 * but for a 2 day stay I could live with it.  I will say though that suprisingly over the 3 days we were there, at no point were there any hand towels in the restaurant toilets! 
Breakfast had plenty of selection but i don't think it was anything special.  Fruit had gone brown and the food in general not great, fruit juices and bottled water both mornings had run out.  We ate in the hotel on our first night (La Fourchette)  it was a set menu for our large group which was ok.
The spa is a really nice feature of the hotel and worth using after a days skiing.  The hotel was quite quiet when we were there so we had it pretty much to ourselves (i think normally they operate on a booking basis).
There is a ski shop onsite too if you have forgotten anything! All in all, a nice and pleasant stay but not quite sure it hits the 5* ranking.

Title: Stunning
Text: Fabulous stay. Gorgeous hotel with super friendly and helpful staff. Close enough to walk down into the centre - about 10 mins but something of an incline on the way back. Good excuse for another Aperol! The courtesy bus was a godsend and all the drivers were so friendly. Food was delicious for breakfast and we also had an amazing dinner on the first night as the snow was coming down and we just wanted to stay indoors. Suffice to say it was fab. We had a pre dinner drink in the bar which was great - basically acted as a starter with all the accompaniments. The only thing I’d change was some tea/coffee making facilities in the room and a bath alongside the shower. Although the gorgeous pool/spa did the trick after skiing. Thoroughly recommend.

Title: Superior
Text:
We stayed three nights in mid March and were really happy about the hotel. We didn’t have any expectations but the place was really nice, clean and got us on a good mood.

We got upgraded to Junior Suite, which was extremely nice and big. Great views to the mountains. Room for clothes, big shower/toilet room. We slept well!

Beautiful American bar with cosy sofas and fireplace. A bit pricy drinks but it included tasty snacks and we went here every night before heading to dinner.

Spa area with saunas was amazing! Small pool, but really relaxing saunas after  a long day full of skiing.

Highly recommended!

Title: Update
Text: The hotel was kind enough to listen to my criticism and was nothing but kind for the rest of the stay. Thank you for the effort. They even found apples for the spa when someone had taken them all. Very nice pool and spa

Title: Not a 5 star hotel when it comes to service
Text:
This hotel has a very amateur management structure and it’s not 100% client focused as we would expect. Nothing to say about infrastructure but the management and the “rules” they pass to the guests are just stupid - example: don’t loose your keycard or you will be penalized in 10
Euros. This is just one of the stupid things that sum up and show that we are dealing with “low cost” mentality people (the managers or the owners). The vans to catch you at the ski station were very rarely on time and you would have to call to the hotel complaining so that they would send someone after a tough ski day. Also there was clearly less staff for the season as you could see the drivers (nice people) doing other works to cover the gaps and desperate to do everything they could -
This means bad planning.
Overall We got very disappointed since we were expecting an amazing service and we got a very low service low cost mentality in a great infrastructure. Keep the hotel, change the owners/managers urgently. They don’t know what great service is about

Title: Excellent Weekend birthday SKi trip
Text:
This was a surprise trip for my wife’s birthday with some friends. We flew into Geneva and had a simple transfer followed by a quick and speedy checkin at the hotel.  It was extremely nice to get a room upgrade to a suite which was a great start to the holiday. The rooms are beautiful, modern and contemporary but they still make you feel like you are in a ski resort with warm wooden fittings. Being a short break we wanted a quick turnaround to get changed into our ski gear, get our hire gear and be on the slopes ASAP. The on-site ski hire did just that. It wasn’t open when we arrived, but it wasn’t a problem. Reception called Massimo and he was there in 15 minutes to get us ski ready. The on-site lockers are really handy with the locker room opening onto the on-site parking where the shuttle was waiting to take us. It is literally a 5 minute drive the to Dolonne bubble lift, which was quicker than some ski-in ski out resorts. After a days skiing we would find ourselves in the spa, relaxing in the pool, steam room and sauna - a great way to wind down.
In the evening we would go to the bar before heading out for dinner. Omar and Luca produced some amazing cocktails including one they made up on the spot which included my favourite ingredients. I think we agreed to call it a Luma in the end.
The breakfast buffet gives you everything you need before heading out onto the slopes.
I will definitely be coming back to this hotel and courmayeur. An absolute treasure.

Title: Hotel of fairytales
Text:
This is the kind of hotel of fairytales. Stunningly beautiful, contemporary but still warm and welcoming. Stylish with outstanding local charm.
This hotel has everything... A good location, an amazing bar with a very nice and professional Barman (Omar), large comfortable rooms, a spa, a ski hire shop and a private shuttle to the lifts. 
The room (suite) which includes a separate dressing room is very well organized and the spacious bathroom is amazing with a big circular bathtub.
The spa is wonderful, there are multiple shower experiences and an indoor pool with a button triggered waterfall. A spacious outdoor deck is located by the pool with numerous loungers for sunning oneself.
The breakfast was excellent with everything you need.
Definitely 5* service

Title: Not really 5 Star - very noisy.
Text:
Don’t be deceived by the photos. This is a hotel designed to be instagrammed, but it is soulless and certainly not a Five Star Hotel. Had it not been for the extremely helpful staff who tried really hard to provide great service and sort out the problems, I would have rated it only two stars. 

The main problem is the rooms. The walls are extremely thin and noise travels so easily. I could hear the TV and the conversations of the people in the rooms either side. The floors are hardwood and therefore you hear every footstep from the room above. Clearly this is a design fault, and the management did their best to solve the problem but if you are there when it is busy or with lots of noisy families, it could be a nightmare.

I would also say that breakfast is very ordinary in terms of choice of food - few cereals and fresh fruit and things like eggs, omelettes etc are an extra charge.

The spa is good, but they don’t seem to bother keeping it tidy so it looks a complete mess with towels strewn all around and the bin piled high with plastic cups.

There are better hotels in Courmayeur and it is very expensive for what it is. The staff however are excellent and extremely helpful.

Title: Beautiful hotel, modern luxury.
Text:
We received an upgrade. The room is beautifully decorated with a balcony and stunning views on the mountains. The service is amazing, there is a free shuttle at your disposal, it can take you to anywhere in Courmayeur. We used it to get to the Skyway (must see), and called the hotel when we finished and they sent the shuttle to us (arrived in 5 minutes) and he took us to the center. Then again picked us up back to the hotel! AMAZING SERVICE. 

The food is also very good, we tried dinner (very good) and the american bar (we had a snack). Also, breakfast is good with nice views. All staff are attentive and friendly. 

Spa area is nice as well. We used the indoor pool and sauna.

Title: Great spot
Text: In the beginning of the summer season we visited this great hotel. It is a very nice modern 5 star hotel, but still in the local mountain style. We had a junior suite, this is an amazing room. The dressing room is great and spacious. Bathroom is very luxureous with a big bath. The manager was very friendly and service oriented. Restaurant has a great view at the mont blanc.  We really enjoyed our stay and i would recommend it to everyone who wants a great experience in the mountains.

Title: Nice hotel
Text: Pretty, nice clean hotel. Comfortable beds. Good breakfast. Nice views. Good parking.It is a little bit out of town but not inconvenient. We were driving to France after an overnight flight from the US so this was a perfect stopover for us for a couple of nights to recover. Relaxing and lots of fun.

Title: A great stopover
Text:
Driving from Italy to France through the Mont Blanc tunnel (or the other way around) requires some planning especially during the holiday periods when getting through the tunnel can entail a frustrating 2 hour wait.  So check the tunnel website and chose your time and day carefully.
You will note that there is  never a wait before 10  AM. So why not break the journey in Courmayeur and spend the night there. You will find that the Grand Hotel has a heated pool and an outstanding restaurant. Not cheap but you get what you pay for.

Title: Summer in the mountains
Text: This 5 star boutique hotel was beyond expectations. Eating while looking at the snow capped Mont Blanc in the summer is just breathtaking. The staff was friendly and helpful when needed. The hotel is right on the border so you can go to France and even Switzerland for day trips. We've stayed at the hotel twicew and would go again.

Title: Outstanding Treasure of a Hotel
Text:
I stayed with my family at the Grand Hotel in Courmayeur, Italy in August 2018. We had a magnificent time.  And it all started with an outstanding staff.  They were very warm, responsive and accommodating.  They went waaayy our of their way to make us feel comfortable.  One employee, Riyadh, actually brought dinner (unsolicited) to our room when my six year old was too tired to join us for dinner. 

The hotel is warm, the rooms very comfortable.  They have a great spa and pool.  And the views are breathtaking.  That is not an exaggeration.  The hotel is at the foot of Mont Blanc and the vista is out of this world.  The location was perfect - a mere 30 minutes to incredibly beautiful Chamonix (in France) and Aosta (in Italy).

I highly HIGHLY recommend the Grand Hotel.  They truly made our vacation memorable.

A pic from our room balcony is below.

Title: Good hotel, nice location
Text: I stayed one night at the Grand Hotel Courmayeur on a business trip. The location is great, just a short drive away from Geneva. It's surrounded by the best landscapes the European Alps have to offer. Dinner and breakfast were fine, I enjoyed the cocktail selection at the bar in the evening.

Title: An extended weekend ski
Text:
Well appointed hotel. 
1.5 hrs from Geneva airport.
Convenient for slopes and village and great hotel shuttle service to lifts and town.
Very accommodating staff.
Lovely rooms.
Ski lifts and service good.

Title: Great Hotel for organizing your incentive
Text:
For our yearly End of Year Offsite we booked all rooms in the Grand Hotel Courmayeur. 

The hotel staff was friendly and professional, they made sure it was a visit to remember for everybody. Special thanks to kitchen and service brigade; they pulled it off to serve a great diner and lunch for the entire group (exceeded their normal capacity by 40 people). The hotel manager very attentive and has a good eye for details when organizing an event for 200 people.

Title: Not a five star hotel
Text:
Stayed here for two days last week on business. The hotel is lovely and in a great location with incredible surrounding views of the mountains. 

We arrived and there were still people in our room. I know this because we were given the key card and we walked in on two people in bed watching tv! Had to wait two hours whilst they were kicked out and eventually they gave us a different room. 

The rooms were nice - laid out well with a big TV, great bathroom and again good views. 

Downsides, the hallways are shabby and in need of refurbishment. The food was bang average - breakfast was not nice. The hot breakfast is basically tiny sausages and scrambled egg. We ate as soon as it opened thinking it would be hot and fresh and tasty but it really wasn't good. 

Staff were friendly though, but bar staff very very slow indeed. Shuttle buses around Courmayeur are free and useful although most things are walkable.

Title: Perfect venue for a long ski weekend
Text:
Left London at 4am and we were on the slopes at 11am Italian time, having arrived at 10.15 at the hotel and been delighted to find our hotel room was ready.  The hotel shuttle to and from the gondolas was available immediately and proved a good service over four days. We walked back to the hotel once instead of waiting - only 15 minutes. Tip - hire and leave skis and boots overnight up at the top of the gondolas at Plan Checrouit - fantastic service in the family run ski hire place at the top of the lift.

Hotel staff - very professional, helpful and friendly.

Hotel room (we had junior suite but were upgraded) was extremely comfortable, extremely clean, well equipped.  Hotel spa was good quality - either empty or, over the weekend, full to capacity - they ask guests to reserve slots to regulate the numbers; it's free tor guests to use the pool, sauna, steam room.  Piano bar was lovely for apres ski drinks, pre spa.  Couldn't understand why it wasn't busier - drinks sensibly priced for high end hotel bar. 

Food - breakfast offered the usual extensive fresh range for a five star hotel, but we were surprised to have to pay extra for eggs, smoothies etc off the menu.  Had dinner in the hotel the first night - food delicious and the service good.  Front desk (Federica and Enrico in particular very helpful) recommended and booked good restaurants for us.  We came armed with food and bar suggestions from friends, but wouldn't have found Dandelion Cuisine de Montagne without Federica's suggestion. What a fantastic meal!  

Will definitely return to Courmayeur and look forward to staying in this hotel again.

Title: I must have left a piece of my heart back at Grand Hotel Courmayeur Mont Blanc
Text:
We booked a junior suite and when we arrived at the reception they offered me a free upgrade in Suite! This was amazing!!! We are regular 5-star hotel guests and this hotel has a special appeal.
From the moment we arrived the staff was so wonderful, very friendly and always available. Everybody, especially the reception, went out of their way to help us and they were very efficient and keen in their duties.
We spent only three days and tried the restaurant just once, but overall the menu was good but the wine list a little bit poor for a 5-star hotel. The breakfasts were very good but we did not understand why we had to pay extra for eggs: breakfast is breakfast! 
Although some little details could improve, this was one of my best experience for a ski holiday. We warmly recommend this hotel!!!

Title: Nice Hotel, lovely Spa but beware additional charges at breakfast
Text:
Firstly, lets concentrate on the positives.  This is a very nice hotel, located a 10 minute walk from the centre of the town.  Rooms are clean & contemporary & the Spa is excellent, although you can only use it for 90 minutes a day & it must be booked.  That said, it was empty when we went in & 90 minutes was more than enough.  The Hotel has a great ski locker room for your boots & ski.  There is a small ski rental shop in the hotel but we didn't use it to rent ski's so cannot comment.  The Hotel runs a regular shuttle bus to the ski lifts, very good service...this can be used to drop you in the town too....but the walk is quite nice so not really necessary.  always be sure to call the shuttle when you are at the top of the lift, to be sure you diont have to wait too long at the bottom.  

In terms of breakfast, be aware that even though you may be on a B&B basis, items cooked by the chef ( such as eggs & omlettes) are not included.  This was not explained to us at any point during our stay & was disappointing to receive an additional bill at check out.  Thankfully the Hotel did remove these charges after some discussion.  It is fair to say the Hotel is very nice but also very quiet & is not one for having any apres or relaxing drinks, as the bar area is very small.  That said we found Courmayeur as a resort is quite quiet & if you require lively bars, or somewhere with atmosphere, it may be worth considering somewhere else

Title: Good, but not great.
Text:
My family and I (two adults and two teenage girls) stayed at the Grand Hotel Courmayeur during a ski trip in December 2017. 

The hotel has a very nice modern décor, with wood accents in the rooms. My wife and I stayed in one room, and my teenage daughters in another. The rooms are very nice and modern, but not particularly large. One of the rooms was on one side of the hotel and the other on the other side, and both had very nice views of the surrounding mountains.

The service was generally very nice, particularly at the front desk. The restaurant looks very nice as well, and the service is fairly good, but the food itself frankly leaves much to be desired. One reason we love travelling to Italy is because of the food, and we found the food at the Grand mediocre and expensive (except breakfast, which was pretty good, but how can it not be with the excellent hams and cheeses to be found in Italy). There are much better dinning options in town.

The hotel's locations is fine, but not great. It's not in the town center, but not far from it, about an 8-10 min walk. However, it is not really close to the ski lifts, so you will have to use the shuttle. However, they only have a mini van that fits eight, which means long waits (once we waited 45 min) at the end of the ski day when you want to catch a lift back to the hotel. Every other guest we spoke to was similarly displeased with this. The hotel does have a good ski locker room. You can also rent skis at the hotel, but the staff in charge of this was not all that easy for us to find. Returning the skis, however, was a breeze: you just leave them in your locker. 

The hotel has a small, free, outdoor parking, in case you rent a car, but if you want covered garage you'll have to shell out 40 EUR per night. 

Lastly, the spa: For us, a key part of après-ski involves dipping our sore bodies in a nice hot tub, but in this hotel the spa did not have one. I'm not sure how anything can be called a spa without a hot tube, but there it is. Fortunately, the neighboring town of Pre-Saint-Didier has a very nice, if a bit crowded, spa with natural springs (QC Terme), and we went there once. This entailed a 15 min drive (fortunately we had a car), and a reservation. That was ok, but not the same as having a hot tub in the hotel you're staying at. 

Overall good, but not great.

Title: Fantastic hotel with excellent service
Text: We arrived at Grand Hotel Courmayeur the first of January. As soon as we arrived we felt welcomed and well attended. My first impresión was that the hotel had a very nice interior design with a Scandinavian feel to it. Nothing fancy yet everything looked very well made.  The rooms are quite spacious yet very cozy. All rooms have balconies with great views. Breakfast was included and the service and food surpassed my expectations. All of the waiters, bar tenders gave us nothing but excellence. I applaud who ever is in charge of them. The location of the hotel is not in town which I like because of the peace and quite. To get to town it's only a 10/15 minute walk at the most. Shuttle service to get to the slopes is available on demand so you don't have to worry about transportation. Ski rentals are also available on site which is practical. The only thing I personally did not like was the Spa. In itself it's nice and service is good. What I personally didn't like was that the let  kids and even moms with babies inside the spa areas. I wanted peace/quite/relaxation and found myself in a summer public pool. Other than that I loved this hotel. I will return soon !

Title: Superb
Text: We spent a week at this wonderful hotel. I have only positive things to say about the hotel. It is a modern, well planned, comfortable and spacious hotel. The rooms are nice and very modern. The bathroom is very spacious. The internal pool and spa are very nice. Staff is very service oriented and friendly. Parking is also available.

Title: The Grand Hotel is GRAND!
Text: I've just returned this evening from a week at the Grand Hotel. It is a beautiful hotel in the middle of a small, absolutely breathtaking town, facing Mont Blanc. The place is immaculate, the food is plentiful (and that's an understatement) and delicious- too delicious!! The high quality and selection of fresh vegetables and fruits available on a daily basis were amazing.  The staff is indescribable- top notch+.. They are soft spoken, knowledgeable, helpful.. they are simply fantastic!  In short, I had a true vacation and came home refreshed and relaxed and ready to return to reality.. well, almost!

Title: Fantastic hotel, fabulous staff
Text:
We just returned from 9 days in Courmayeur, we stayed in the Grand Hotel -it was absolutely wonderful. We would like to comment on the wonderful, exemplary staff. The entire staff was welcoming, pleasant and far more than competent.  The rooms were really  nice, the scenery (we had a porch) and dining room views are breathtaking.

I would like to single out Cecilia for her incredible service.  Our first day, indeed, right after check in, I lost the crown on one of hmy teeth.  This would have changed our plans and ruined our entire vacation. Cecilia called over ten dentists until she found one who could replace the crown on short notice, and arranged for a cab to take us there and back.  In all my years of travel, I have never seen such devotion.  She was unfailingly welcoming and kind.

My husband has run various social service programs and not for profit corporations. H has never seen such an excellent staff.  If we return to Italy, we will be sure to stay at one of your hotels.  In the mean time,  I will recommend your hotel to all of our friends and students.

Title: Great Summer Vacation Spot
Text: Awesome Hotel, Amazing views of the mountains from all windows, great location (20 minutes to France, 1 hour to Switzerland, 2 hours to Milan, etc.), VERY Helpful and Nice Staff (especially John/Gian the Hotel Manager and Cecilia at the desk), lots of activities around the hotel and beyond!!! Great Summer Vacation spot... must be even better in the winter.  If you go, ENJOY!!!

Title: Wonderful summer vacation and tour!!
Text: The hotel is beautiful, modern and clean! The staff were gracious and helpful, especially Christina and Sabina when we needed some personal help, (wish we would have remembered more names!) The scenic views are simply spectacular!!

Title: Idyllic Setting and Outstanding Service
Text: We just spent a week at the Grand Hotel Courmayeur.  The hotel is a very stylish hotel with large well appointed rooms. The front desk staff is extremely friendly and most helpful.  The restaurant staff is outstanding, eager to please and anticipated all our needs.

Title: Excellent Service, Beyond Expectation
Text:
Courmayeur is a very picturesque Italian village at the foot of Mt. Blanc. A relatively
short ( 1.5 hour)  drive from Milan. The Grand Hotel is a very modern, very clean,and very welcoming five star hotel  Although the food and amenities are superb, the staff are the best part of the hotel. From Cristina at the Reception to the Manager, John
Sedda, and everyone in between, all go out of their way to be helpful. I, for example
had an issue with my laptop's WIFI reception. This was interfering with my ability to
enjoy my vacation, while still being in touch with my office. Cristina and John arranged for a modem rental and its delivery to be from Milan by taxi. This, of course, is in addition to their constant helpful hints as to local places of interest and available activities.

Title: Truly idyllic hotel and surroundings
Text: Superbly comfortable and highly welcoming hot. First class food, a superb spa and a delightful bar hosted by Luca. Close to proximity to town center and all outdoor amenities. This is a wonderful way to enjoy the Italian alps.

Title: Absolutely amazing
Text:
Sadly I just had the chance to stay there for one night... because I was on a business trip. But if I would stay in this region again I definetly would go there. The room was huge, bed was super-comfy. The view was just perfect! I could see the Mont Blanc from the balcony!!!!
Bathroom was really big, nice bathtub. 
Service was friendly and the food was good.

Title: Great hotel
Text: This is a modern hotel, very stylish with all the amenities you need. The room was very clean and spacious with a great walk in shower, a large balcony with spectacular views. The towels were refreshed of an evening if needed.  The reception staff were very friendly, helpful and attentive.  The pool and spa facilities are first class. We had a wonderful stay.

Title: In a league of its own
Text: This is the kind of hotel of fairytales. Stunningly beautiful, contemporary but still warm and welcoming. Stylish with outstanding local charm. The views of the mountains were unbelievable. Staff and service was good. One small issue at the spa was rectified quickly. The bedrooms were stunning and the backdrop out of the patio doors was breathtaking. All in all a fabulous holiday and a hotel that is five stars in every way.

Title: Everything You Need In One Place
Text:
This hotel has everything... A good location, a comfortable bar, large comfortable rooms, a spa, a ski hire shop and a private shuttle to the lifts. Perfect.

I booked a Deluxe Double room which was spacious to say the least. The separate bedroom and living area was a bonus and the large modern bathroom with whirlpool bath was a relaxing way to prepare for the evening, after a good day of skiing.

The service is decent and friendly and there isn't even any need to pre-book your ski equipment. Way more convenient than hiring in town.

The Hotel Golf has the luxury sure, but the Grand Mont Blanc is the complete package.

Title: splendid!
Text:
great hotel. extremely friendly and helpful staff. beautiful design and layout.....
lovely spa - food - service - views... all in all the best all rounded hotel I have stayed in for years! And we were kindly upgraded for our special occasion...thank you.

Title: Best hotel in area
Text: Nice, clean modern hotel with good service. The food in the restaurants is delicious especially for dinner. The breakfast buffet is expansive and they keep it open almost a half hour later than stated for late sleepers. The workout room and spa rooms are small but adequate. We joined a group of several couples at the last minute and the hotel accommodated us with a regular room on the first floor. The bed was comfortable. The room was quiet and we had a patio w partial mountain views. The bathroom was quite large for European standards and new. We will return again next year if we are in the area.

Title: A reference in Courmayeur
Text: We regularly stay at this hotel. The modernity of the installations is a real plus. The room (junior suite) which includes a separate dressing room is very well organized and the spacious bathroom is amazing with a big circular bathtub. The staff is really friendly and helpful. The spa is quite big, complete and has a very pleasant atmosphere. The shuttle as well as the indoor parking are also appreciable services. Last but not least, the restaurant has very good and varied dishes.

Title: Not worth 5 stars and Actually overpriced
Text:
Just spend a nice weekend in Courmayeur at the Grand Hotel Courmayeur Mont Blanc. And I'm disappointed to say it, but I will NOT recommend it to anyone and will not come back. 
First advantages: the design is really nice and it was actually the point why I chose this hotel. It is situated in the residential area, so outside is really relaxing and quiet. 
To have a great view I recommend the rooms overlooking Mont Blanc, paired numbers - 202, 204 etc. 
breakfast is ok, the basic level for a 4 star hotel with a nice view. 
The great disappointment is the spa - a small indoor swimming pool with 10 (!!!!!) relax beds. So immagine the high ski season when all the guests of the hotel come to relax in the spa at 5-6 p.m. 
Actually it's a very basic spa, nothing special. If you want a really great and luxury experience - just book the best spa hotel in the area QC Terme Hotel Monte Bianco in the nearest town. Or try Nira Montana in La Thuile. 
Hope the manager of the Hotel will realize that the 5 star service doesn't include only facilities (he cannot change the spa unfortunately). But he could add some pleasant compliments etc like do other luxuries mountain hotels - welcome drink, relaxing mask. Something that could make the stay not average but special.

Title: Wonderful Contemporary Hotel
Text: We have just returned from a fabulous 4 nights in this lovely hotel. Every single one of the staff were all so courteous, welcoming and couldn't do enough to help. Definitely 5* service. We were upgraded on arrival to a deluxe. Room C201 (4th floor) was very comfortable with huge bathroom. V peaceful overlooking mountains. (Requests: A bath! UK channels on TV without supplement. Tea/coffee making facilities in room. 24 hr Room Service (closed at 11pm).) The shuttle minibus service to Dolonne gondola was very efficient and flexible. (Tip: hire your skis up the mountain- makes life much easier!) Very easy max 10 mins walk into the centre (Via Roma) for shops, bars, restaurants. Breakfast was a delicious buffet. We only had to mention once that my daughter was gluten free. Every meal, the waitress automatically brought gluten free options. We even had a whole tray of GF snacks delivered to the room with no charge. Only ate dinner once in the hotel : good choice of local dishes, excellent quality, reasonable and exemplary service. We loved the spa- warm jacuzzi swimming pool, sauna, steam room (dressing gowns, flip flops, products, towels all readily available). Also free hot drinks, fruit, water in the spa to help yourself. We just didn't want to leave! Mille grazie- we will be back!

Title: Beautiful hotel close to downtown
Text:
Nice relatively new hotel in Courmayeur; conveniently located near downtown but in a very quiet area and with beautiful views of the mountains. Modern fittings mostly glass gives lots of light to the inside. Might appear a bit 'cold' (lacks the cozy athmosphere of some mountain hotels) but all very clean and high quality. 
Dinner in the restaurant was very good quality and waiters very nice with us and the kids. 
Rooms very nicely furnished all very modern. 
Nice terrace to enjoy the sun.

Title: Long weekend skiing
Text:
The building is great, modern and contemporary, rooms spacious and clean, and there is a great spa area and pool. Ideally located for walking into town to the many restaurants and shops, and there is a free shuttle bus to the ski lift.
The staff were super helpful in recommending and booking restaurants, but I would recommend checking your bill when checking out as both couples had charges for the bar which were made before we even arrived! I am positive that this was a genuine error and nothing untoward.
Drinks at the bar were costly, but so was everything else in Courmayeur so this isn't a reflection on the hotel.
The breakfast buffet was delicious, especially if you have a sweet tooth. There was a great variety to suit everyone though, and plenty of food and good coffee.
The only negatives were that it felt more like a business hotel than a ski resort accommodation; there wasn't much atmosphere. The staff, although very courteous and friendly, were slow in responding to requests, and it's not really necessary to bring a bottle of wine to the table on a trolley!
In summary, everything was fine, but some ambience missing!

Title: Ski vacation
Text:
Certainly not 5 star. 
Disjointed in layout 
Rooms small
Noisy 
The insulation between floors/ rooms a bit thin 
Spa ok 
Breakfast rubbish .
Reception helpful 
Ski service ok 
On the edge on the town so walking needed to go into town

Title: Nice hotel but not a 5* service
Text:
The hotel is a very recent building with good design. Rooms and bathrooms are nice although standard doubles are small for a supposed 5*. The spa is pleasant, can get crowded in the afternoon. Location is good, car/shuttle is necessary to reach the lifts up to the slopes.

Staff is friendly but service is not exactly in line with price they charge: eg difficult to get anything to eat if arriving late, private car parking costs Eur30/night but you may be asked to go get the car by yourself, the shuttle to the lift should run at all times but we once had to wait for close to 1h before being picked up. Restaurant food is fine but would not say the best in Courmayeur, the breakfast choice is underwhelming for Italian standards.

Overall a nice and pleasant stay and good value if booked on discounted rate, but hardly worth the rack rate.

Title: Lovely hotel that doesn't quite deliver
Text:
Beautiful hotel a short walk to the centre of town. We found out on their website about a great anniversary package, which resulted in us being upgraded to a beautiful junior suite. The room was fantastic with the biggest bath tub you've ever seen. 

The spa is good, but they need more beds to relax on around the pool.

Breakfast was good but I was very disappointed with the choice. I am gluten free and had phoned ahead to inform them - they said that was no problem - however, no gf bread appeared on the 3 mornings we were there even after speaking to the front desk twice about it.

Another frustration was the satellite TV wasn't working in our room, so we  couldn't watch any English speaking channels. The front desk blamed it on the weather (even on a fine day). We were not convinced given we are in a mountain resort + all the bars were able to show sport, etc, on their TVs.

The real let down for our party was the shuttle service from the hotel to the cable car that takes you up the mountain. There is one shuttle bus that seats 8 that they use to shuttle guests. There are many guests, so the queue is long and we waited 45 mins on the first day outside in sub-zero conditions so as not to lose our place in the queue. On the second day we had to split up our party of 6 to fit on the shuttle, which resulted in more wasted time. They really need 2 buses at peak times, or a bigger bus.

In summary: the hotel itself is very nice, but needs to work better on customer service to be worthy of their 5* rating and the price tag.

Title: Grand Hotel Courmayeur Mont Blanc
Text: With friends we spent in this hotel very nice autumn weekend. Accommodation and meals perfect. I can also recommend a very clean and modern spa - swimming pool and sauna, which offers lovely views of Mont Blanc.You can enjoy with ur familly and friends.

Title: Good property, nice staff, poor food
Text: The room was fine, nicely designed, could have used a little more closet space. Facilities excellent. The staff were always helpful and friendly, though some seemed inexperienced and stretched. The restaurant was poor, especially for a five star hotel. Most restaurants in Courmayeur were better, and food is not the priority in a ski resort. Parking charge is now 30 Euros a night..

Title: NOT A 5 STARS HOTEL
