Text: I have visited Grand Hotel courmayeur for the new year's eve 2017. Stayed for 9 nights. The hotel is a definetly 3 stars one,  not a 5 one. The staff is mostly rude, not willingful to help. They do not have a decent lobby as a 5 stars hotel should have

Title: Amazing new hotel, for skiing the rooms are small, not close to piste!
Text: the beautiful  hotel is brand new, just openend. the rooms are nice but for skein maybe a bit small. id like to have a bit more space. the badroom is big enough! so thats a big plus. the breakfast is big and serves all sorts of food. in the hotel you can rent skies and change clothes, a mini van brings you to the ski lifts just 5/10 min fro the hotel. and picks you up again. if you want to be close to the skilifst this might not be your hotel.

Title: Great place and great location
Text:
Been here December 2016. Hotel is great, top class in terms of location, rooms clean and luxury as expected. 
Spa is not huge but very good, even if customer service is not as top as the place itself. 
Cortina city center is at walking distance.

Title: Very nice hotel
Text: We really enjoyed our one week stay at the hotel.  It's not truly 5* but a very comfortable 4*.  Public areas are bright and modern with breathtaking views.  Top notch spa.  Our room was comfortable and had great views.  The only drawback is that there is no A/C and it was hot during our visit in late August.  If you open the balcony door there's beautiful cool mountain air but also noise from the street if you're facing the front.  So ask for a rear facing room.  We were part of a kosher group and the food and the service was excellent.  All the staff were friendly and helpful, especially the front desk, so I'm puzzled by some of the negative comments.  It's true that the hotel is a little outside the center of town, but we viewed that as a plus, and it's a pleasant 10 minute walk to the center of Courmeyeur.  Parking is a a bit of a pain. You can either pay Euro 20 a night to park in their garage, or you can park on the street nearby - although spaces are limited.

Title: The worst 5*
Text:
As a real client who has been in the hotel this weekend, I will classify this 5 star hotel as the worst 5 star I have been in, from the service to the infrastructure and maintenance.
I know the infrastructure is not the fault of the people who are present daily that execute the different services, but daily operations can make one forget the imperfection in the infrastructure.
Arrival at the hotel, no one to welcome you and help with the luggage, but mind you someone is busy talking on the phone outside whilst we wait, turn out it was the management staff who could not be bothered until he finished his phone call. 
Check in procedure, we are directed to public parking as parking infront of reception is full and mind you we had paid the parking beforehand. We are requested to pay 20euro should we want to use the underground parking. The reception did not know we had paid (they did not have the information). At arrival we learn that the restaurant are closed for the two nights for the profit of a private event, they could have been informed.
The room is big , enough space for the four of us....brand new and modern. However the bathroom is not ventilated at all thus smell of mould.
At night impossible to sleep as its hot, asked about the aircon, answer is there is none because it is a mountain hotel. So we slept with the balcony door open, thanks god the surrounding is quiet.
Friday night we wanted to go to the bar, waited, no bar man thus we ended up leaving.
Breakfast, simple with the necessities except for cream for coffee, they do not have cream for coffee.
Spa swimming pool is nice, we enjoy the swimming pool, though a bit surprised at the note on the door that  you cannot use the spa/swimming pool the day you check in and the day you are checking out. Why?
Twice in a row (Saturday night and Sunday morning) in the garage, the staff use the garage as smoking and break area. Seriously? So your guest have to walk next to your staff smoking in the garage, and your guest has to see your kitchen staff in the white uniform sitting down in the garage smoking? Unacceptable for a 4 star and let alone a 5*.
Courmayeur is a lovely area, very green, clean and beautiful. In great company we had a nice weekend and did not let these hiccups ruin the weekend., but you can be sure I do not reccomend this hotel as a 5 star.
Advise, sometimes the little difference, the human touch makes all the differences in the imperfections.

Title: Gorgeous views, boutique hotel
Text:
Courmayeur is a beautiful place to relax in the summer.  The Grand Hotel Courmayeur is  great place to relax in Courmayeur.  The hotel only has about 72 rooms in three connected buildings.  The view from the terrace on our room was awesome !  What a sight to get up to every morning !  

The room was spacious, queen size mattress ( we usually sleep in a king), but very comfortable.  Bedding was excellent with choice of pillows.  The bathroom was extremely spacious.  The hotel is new, having just opened a couple of years ago and still has that new hotel smell.  The staff is extremely courteous and attentive.  We had a problem with the safe and the receptionist that answered the phone immediately came up to the room to reset the safe.

The spa is wonderful  I had a great massage at a reasonable price.  They have multiple shower experiences and am indoor pool with a button triggered waterfall.  A spacious outdoor deck is located by the pool with numerous loungers for sunning oneself.

The only negative was the lack of air conditioning in the rooms.  The weather cools off nicely at night, but one needs to leave the door to the terrace open.  Our room was off the road, so it had a great view but you heard cars going by most of the night with the door open.  The room was soundproof with the door closed.  A ceiling fan would be a great addition to the rooms.

Title: Mixed but overall disappointing experience
Text:
We chose this hotel because we thought we would have a five star hotel experience, and we were willing to pay a bit more for a perfect visit, but we were not happy overall with our choice.  In summary:  (i) The location of this hotel is not ideal.  It is set high on a hill above a park, and the main attractions are all downhill.  Our visit was in the summer, but we imagine this will be especially inconvenient in the winter months.  (ii) FYI - The hotel advertises a 'private ski slope', this is just a small gentle 'bunny slope' for children.  (iii) The hotel is relatively new and has a nice modern design, especially in the layout of the junior suite we occupied (big and nicely appointed bathroom and walk-in closet), but surprisingly does not have the benefit of air conditioning.  The room had doors, not windows, so we had to sleep with the doors open.  The light on the porch could not be turned off which was annoying.  (iv) Bottled water is not provided free to guests.  WE thought this odd for a hotel of this stature.  (v) The gym is tiny and not well ventilated.  (vi) Our room faced the valley, rather than Mont Blanc.  On the same side of the hotel is the hotel pool and a children's park next door, so we heard a chorus of screaming children every afternoon. (vii)  There is free parking available in front of the hotel for only 12 cars (if parked well).  A garage is available for a nightly fee.  (viii) We were told before our arrival that the hotel dining room was fully booked for the entire period of our visit; what we were not told was the reason for this - a tour group was there throughout our visit.  Not our idea of a quiet and relaxing holiday break.  Overall, we would say this hotel did not provide value for money.
However, we would conclude by saying, the most positive aspect of our stay were the staff who were all friendly and very helpful.

Title: Beautiful location
Text: We had a room with a balcony facing Mont Blanc. What a view to wake up to each morning. Nice small spa with a small pool, sauna with a glass wall with a view, hamam and aromatherapy showers. Really comfy beds. The staff were exceptional and went out of their way for us. Good location for hiking, canyoning and other summer activities.

Title: Amazing hotel
Text: we stayed here as part of a group tour for a week in August 2016. I found that the service was excellent. very pleasant and always available to help. the waitstaff was always friendly, available and eager to help. The hotel itself is gorgeous both in the views and scenery it affords and the actual hotel as well. We would not hesitate to come back and stay here.

Title: Spa and restaurant were closed
Text: The hotel is probably not too bad,especially spa, room was big and clean (luxe), but the politic of the hotel was more when surprising-they had the 'special guests' from Israel, and spa was reserved for them for the evening hours,and the restaurant was closed as well!! Because they cooked only 'kosher' food-NONSENSE! Thanks god,they served a breakfast, but also,separately. Could not even order some food at the evening because of that-very disappointing decision to close all the services for the other clients,because of the 'special' guests. So be advised to check at the hotel before, would you be able to use spa and restaurant.

Title: Not recommended for those looking for good service and luxury hotel
Text:
No charme or appropriate service in any part od the hotel. Non existant concierge. Recommendations for restaurants terrible with no possibility to book any decent one weeks in advance. Hotel restaurant understaffed. Spa overcrowded (6 beds and 6 chairs for hotel this size) Kids running around the pool in the evening eventhouth hotel policy does not allow kids entering after 3pm. Room cleaning not finished by 4pm ?? On the positive: Good beds and pillows. Nice sauna room with a view. 
Service, attention to details and warm welcome not perceived as important. Any of our complaints was not followed by a feedback. Never experienced something like this. All in all... If management of the hotel does not understand this very soon the hotel will only cater one time guests. Ok but far away from special experience. Would not return.

Title: Best 5* hotel in Courmayeur
Text: Brand new, opened one year ago. Second time here and probably it's not the last one. Comfortable and well decorated rooms, nice SPA, breakfast buffet is rich and full of local product (Panizzi yoghurt is a must). We were on half board and restaurant menu changed every day, get ready to put some kilos on during your stay. Last, but not least, shuttle bus to Dolonne.

Title: Shocking service
Text: Nice design, but it really doesn't mean much, when the service is so shocking that all you can think of is moving to another hotel. Unfriendly and even rude staff, lack of hygiene, awful room service. I am genuinely puzzled how they passed the 5 star rating. Shockingly overpriced for the services that they provide. In my view 3 stars for their services would be a stretch.

Title: Great facilties, poor service
Text:
Fantastic facilities and beautiful location, however the service was especially poor from the front of house staff. The other members of staff were very helpful and attentive- but reception were continually rude and unhelpful to multiple members of our group. Not what you would expect from a five star hotel.
Breakfast was excellent and the rooms were pristine and well decorated.

Title: Sleek hardware marred by weak hospitality
Text:
We stayed one week at this hotel. It was our second visit to Courmayeur, and though we enjoyed Au Couer des Neiges last time we decided to try GHC because of the modern design and spa photos on the hotel website.  I regret this decision:  the hotel hardware is indeed nice but there was a distinct lack of hospitality.  Staff seemed cold and seldom smiled. They didn’t seem interested in welcoming guests, a big contrast to Au Couer and hotels like Auberge where even as dinner guests we felt very warmly received. 

The rooms are modern, with cute bronze snowflake door handles and comfortable beds. Our room was in the main building on the lobby level and had a sliding door to an outdoor patio.  There are some design quirks:  our regular room had little room for luggage but the adjoining junior suite had an enormous walk-in closet.  There is a long desk but it lacks plugs.  The bathroom is big but has limited counter space and the water splashes out of the shower due to an inadequate glass enclosure.

The free Wifi requires user ID and password which are on little slips of paper you need to request from the front desk.  Though the paper says valid for 1 week but it expired within 4 days. It was tedious inputting these into my phone and computer and sorting this out for the kids as well.  There was no guide on how to use the hotel phone to dial the operator, room service, spa, etc.  Sometimes when calling the operator, there was no answer.  

The 2/F restaurant was disappointing.  There was little ambiance and the lady in charge who took our order seemed stressed.  Our order took 1 hour and when it arrived two dishes were incorrect and steaks were well-done instead of medium-rare.  The carpaccio was beautifully plated but flavorless. There was no children’s menu either.  As a result, we needed to pick up food from places in town when the kids wanted to eat in.  Fortunately there are plenty of nice restaurants in Courmayeur so we didn’t eat in the hotel restaurant after the first night.

Breakfast is reasonably good but isn’t available until 7:30am.  There is a selection of juices and fruits, hams and baked goods.  Too bad the scrambled eggs and bacon on the buffet were cold because the serving tray had no heat source.  Other hot items like omelettes are extra.  Service here was better except for the same lady supervisor from the dinner restaurant who was unhelpful.

The spa has a lovely pool and various chromatherapy showers, steam and sauna with a view. The spa attendent was the most energetic and friendly staff in the whole hotel. 

There is a shuttle van to take you to the various lifts/trams in Courmayeur as the hotel is not ski-in/ski-out. It’s a nice brand new van but only seats around 5-6 people max so isn’t the solution for a big group. The main town centre is about a 7-10 minute walk away.

In summary, this hotel has beautiful hardware but the hospitality didn’t match up to the physical premises.

Title: Amazing 5 star hotel but some of the staff very poor
Text: I write this review having stayed 6 night and the hotel was first class and very high quality. Rooms to a high standard and Spec. Sadly the hotel does is not really set up for English guests, I ordered poached egg 3 morning 2 of the staff did not understand the order, 1st morning they were dumped on the plate 2nd morning I sent them back as they very raw 3rd morning they never came so I just had toast.  On the final night I order a veg option rather then fish and was given some very over cook vegetables. On my table one of the organisors ask Marcos about an issue and he become very rude with her. The issue seemed to be that a number of the staff did not speak much English and has very limited customer care experience. So the tip would be if you are Italian it should be fine, if you are not or do not speak Italian. Also for large booking the dinner was poor when have 80 for dinner and kitchen was out of it's depth.

Title: Skiing in the Italian Alps
Text: The hotel is one year old and is beautiful. The people her are as helpful as can be. From breakfast in the morning to drinks in the bar lounge apre' ski was a great experience.  My wife says the Spa was a little noisy but, the facial she received was fabulous. Not a lot of excitement here but very nice. I will return.

Title: OK, but lacking the bells and whistles (and service) of a 5 star
Text:
We stayed here last weekend as a family while we skied with friends in Courmayeur. The hotel employs a nordic, minimalist-chic aesthetic, which is successful overall in that the rooms are simple and clean, albeit small.  The beds are very comfortable and the bedding is lovely. The bathrooms are clean, although our towel warmer did not work (a nice-to-have during a normal visit, but an absolute necessity when you are skiing and need to dry out damp ski gear), the towels are fine and there are bathrobes and slippers in the rooms, though the latter are the cheap, disposable kind.  The complimentary bath soaps, etc are nothing special and not what you'd expect from a 5 star hotel.  

There is a ski storage room downstairs, which would have been great, except for the fact that both lockers we used did not have functional warming tubes so we returned in the morning to find our boots and gloves in no better condition than we'd left them the night before.  

We attempted to order room service one evening and could not get through for over 15 minutes and eventually resorted to calling the main reception. The room service menu is quite sparse, although the food was well presented when it did arrive, although incredibly over-priced for my son's pasta with butter. 

The breakfast buffet is fresh and flavorful, but fairly sparse in their offerings.

Service, overall, was not great. The staff don't appear very happy and while they did answer questions when we had them, did not do anything above or beyond, or even smile at us or wish us a good day.  Having stayed at 5 star hotels the world over, I would say this one needs to spend a lot more time on the details and on their customer service in order to bring it back to that level. 

Courmayeur itself is a really lovely little ski town and has plenty to offer for skiers and diners. The skiing was fabulous and the views are breathtaking, so please don't take my review as a reason not to come to Courmayeur, we would happily return, perhaps not to this hotel, but certainly to the valley itself.

Title: Nice fabric, poor service
Text: Good looking hotel and room was very nice but the service was bizarre? We found it impossible to be served wine at dinner, the bar service was lacking and the lottery of breakfast was almost comedic - no glasses for juice, ordered food being delivered incorrectly on multiple occasions, no certainty of coffee ever arriving and heaven help you if you tried to engage the staff. the Wi-FI did not function consistently and the shower temperature changed of its own accord. If they could sort the service out this would be a great hotel - however I will look elsewhere next time.

Title: Good, but not great.
Text:
Lot of things are good in this hotel, but it's missing these small extras that make your stay memorable.

At the room rate, you'd expect things like parking or ski locker to be included instead of being paid additionally (30euro) without any other option available.

Spa area is a big plus - pool is excellent, but in overall you expect more within this price range.

Title: It is a pleasure
Text: Courmayeur  is a lovely skiing town in Alpes and Grand Hotel Mont Blanc is the place to stay. It is a very nice and comfortable hotel.  Nice view of Mont Blanc from rooms . The rooms are wide and comfortable. All hotel facilities are modern. The bar and sun terrace is perfect. The receptionists are polite and helpful. It is a very nice hotel to stay.

Title: Modern and warm luxury
Text:
I went with my wife to this hotel for our anniversary. We were looking for a very nice place in the mountains, with a nice SPA and nicely located. Well we were not disappointed and you get the luxury you are paying for.

First, although the reception is a bit cold (I have seen friendlier places, even in Palaces), they were perfect and extremely helpful. I had a mistake in my booking (which was a shared mistake between me and the hotel) and they took right away a nice decision without compromising the relaxation nature of our stay there. We really appreciated this gesture and enjoyed every single minute there. 
We also got very good advices to go skating at the Val Ferret with all details on how to go there by bus.

The hotel is really modern and the architecture is stunning. You could imagine it as a huge chalet with large open spaces and all floors viewing to the central reception of the hotel. Everything is brand new (they opened in December 2014) and spotless.The SPA is very nicely located with large windows. It has great amenities (hammam, sauna, many showers, and a swimming pool) and is very relaxing. It maybe lacks a jacuzzi (they could have put one outside for example) but its not a big deal.

You have to walk 5-10 minutes to go to the village but we didn't see this as a problem. You get first a good walk after your big dinners in the evening (which is quite good after polenta, cheeses and various meats...) and then it also ensures the hotel is outside the louder areas of the village, ensuring a calm surrounding.

In the end, we had a great stay and came back relaxed and happy. If you want to have a luxury stay in Courmayeur, this hotel is probably one of the best locations there.

Title: Modern and elegant hotel with a mountain touch
Text: Very beautiful architecture; fits well with the environment. Beautiful and spacious rooms, nice wooden decoration. Attentive staff. Price /quality of the restaurant is ok: food is fine and nicely presented; hardly more expensive than the better restaurants in town. Wifi works very well everywhere in the hotel.Can not find anything negative about this hotel.

Title: Grand but expensive
Text:
We had a very relaxing time in this modern luxury hotel.  The staff were all very helpful.  The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable.  The bathrooms were huge.  The balconies were huge too, with a great view of the mountains.

We rented our skis, boots and helmets from the rental shop in the hotel.  Whilst that was an expensive option it was more then repaid as the shop staff helped us take the gear in and out of the car every day.  In addition it was convenient to just leave it all there at the end of the trip.

Title: Great hotel
Text:
The room we had (junior suite) was fantastic!
Breakfast was great (as previous reviews have said)
The only negative was the hotel (probably because it's relatively new and without a "name" yet in the local community) seemed unable to secure a table for dinner at four or five of the more popular restaurants. 
I would definitely recommend this hotel

Title: Recommend
Text: Very nice facility. The hotel is modern but quite elegant. The service is very good. The Spa could be better in the sense that I would not call the place a hotel  spa, but the facilities they have are ok. The food is good; don't expect one star michelin cuisine, but you will eat well and reasonably priced. I stayed there 2 nights with my wife and I would recommend it.

Title: Spoilt vacations
Text:
Over the last 20 years my wife and I have been spending our vacations in the Alps. In 2015 we decided to stay in Courmayeur. 
In May 2015 we chose a 5* Grand Hotel Courmayeur Montblanc. We sent a reservation request to the Hotel and received a pleasant answer with booking details:
•	If cancelled or modified up to 14 days before date of arrival, 30 percent of the total price of the reservation will be charged;
•	If cancelled or modified later or in case of no-show, the total price of the reservation will be charged.
A booking confirmation was already received on 03.06.15 where the reservation period 25.07.2015-08.08.2015 and the price for 14 nights were mentioned. The correspondence was carried on with manager Alberto Cenci. Moreover, on 26.06.2015 Mr. Maurizio Searrone informed us about the possibility and the price of hotel shuttle service to and from airport.
We bought airplane tickets and happily were looking forward to our vacation. We started exploring the mountain routes and packing sport equipment for hiking. 
However 4 days before departure we were shocked by a certain Mr. Massimo Chiappo’s email that the reservation has been cancelled. Neither explanations, nor apologies were received.  Unilaterally.  
The vacation, tickets and mood were spoilt. 
Based on my experience, I would not recommend the Grand Hotel Courmayer Montblanc to anyone.

Title: Not so Grand
Text:
We stayed at the hotel during mid term in February. First the name is somewhat missleading, its not a very large or grand hotel. Very contemporary in style but unfortunately lacking in ambience. The corridors and dining room gives more the vibes of a hospital than mountain resort. 

Our junior suite was very comfortable and large. Great turn down service and balcony. On yhe negative the hotwater was very hard to control and the tv only had italian channels. The walls are bare and the feeling is cold. 

There is a good skiroom and also a small shop and skirental service. As we left we were informed that the hotel offers skiguides. The spa, pool and gym ate rather small in reality compared to website renderings but all new and fresh. Breakfast was great with beautiful views of the mountiain and good service. However at night the dinning  room ambience is not good. There was a great shuttle service and staff was very pleasant and friendly.

A word of causion. We booked through booking.com and were charged the full weeks stay to our visa debit card the day before we arrived. This is clearly against  the booking rules and if this happens to anyone you should immediately report this to booking.com and request full compensation. We only did this afterwords and never received a proper apology.

For next time we would choose a hotel with a warmer ambience that does not bend the booking rules.

Title: Lovely new hotel
Text:
We stayed for a night in an amazing brand new Junior Suite.
The room is probably 100sqm, with big bathroom (shower + bath tub) and dressing room (perfect to dress up for skiing).
We loved the spa and the breakfast and the free shuttle service to ski piste.

Couple of points to get better:
1) when we were in the SPA (1730-18:30) it was packed ... And with many people it gets messy (towels on the floor and on deck chairs everywhere in the pool); yet there was no personnels cleaning up and putting things in order. 
2) hotel rules says that kids should not be in the pool in the late afternoon ... Yet there were 2 both aged around 4-6. Where was the personnel to check?

Title: Brand new and great location
Text: This hotel has one of the best breakfasts I've ever had! The rooms and the hotel as a whole are beautifully designed. The customer service could improve by a lot but I would give it time. The hotel shuttle is also pretty convenient.

Title: Amazing hotel & great stay!
Text: Loved this hotel! Such luxury, style, and comfort! The rooms are top and services in the SPA were top notch. The hotel is conveniently located approximately 5 minutes walking distance from the city center. I would recommend this hotel to all for a relaxing weekend!

Title: Fantastic hotel and great service
Text: We organized a weekend getaway for a large group at the hotel and had an absolutely fantastic experience.  The staff was extremely accommodating in all of the organization and even more friendly during our stay.  The hotel itself was absolutely beautiful and the facilities were of top quality.  I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a stay in Courma.

Title: An amazing experience in a brand new hotel
Text: Great hotel in a brilliant location in the centre of Courmayeur. The rooms are spacous, very clean, and modern. Staff is friendly and helpful. Fantastic view and relaxed atmosphere. I would highly recommend and will definitely go again!

Title: Unhappy customer
Text: The hotel is convinently located, 10 minutes away from the center (via roma). Though the service i have to say was very lacking. From the cold reception who gave us one key for a double bedroom, up to their continuous disinterest in helping out. As i was there with my sister for only two days, we asked for skii rental shops and clothes, they gave us no help whatsoever. I must say highly dissappointed. We ended up finding skii equipment but through northface the shop without any help from reception who should be aware about the only skii clothing and equipment rental shop in town. Afterwards, in the spa, during a facial, the hot steamer fell on my inner arm causing a mild burn, no first aid assistance was given, i had to pay for my cream, and was not refunded. I must say the hotel is beautiful but the bad service mixed with horrible attitude is what made me write such a review. Customer service is not a 5 star rate.

Title: Great just for dinner
Text: Came here just for dinner which was delicious. It is modern and contemporary, perfect for dinner with a touch of sophistication. Do not go here if you want a noisy family experience, or traditional surrounds. Usefully, the hotel offers underground parking for diners too.

Title: Fab new hotel that should improve in time
Text: I stayed at this new hotel in Courmayeur with my wife and another couple for 4 nights (Sat to Weds) for a short skiing holiday. I was very lucky as I had been to Val D'Isere earlier in the week on a business ski trip. The contrast couldn't be more stark. The GH is in a tranquil setting (about 10 mins walk from Bar Roma) with breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains. It features huge glass windows everywhere and acres of wood and stone. It's the kind of thing you expect to find in Colorado but with a European chalet twist. I thought it worked very well indeed. The rooms (we stayed in a junior suite our friends in a comfort room) were excellent. Only complaint is that the bath was an odd square shape which made it difficult to get comfortable if you are over 6 foot. It also took ages to fill.The ski service and associated ski room were first class. The spa is a real treat. One wall of the Sauna is a huge floor to ceiling pane of glass that looks out towards mountains.  The hotel is new and still finding its feet from a service standpoint (bar service was poor and it lacked ambience - a little good music would have helped rather than the tinny sound of the radio drifting in from bar kitchen!) but this will improve on time.  I'm certainly intending to return next year to find out!!

Title: Brand new Hotel that does the job!
Text:
Stayed here for 3 nights just after it had opened and therefore the service/processes were a little off, but everything was shiny and new to compensate!

The major talking point is the hotels layout which consists of 3 linked buildings which made getting around less easy than normal. For example to get to breakfast I take only 1 of the 2 lifts down, walk across to reception and then take the stairs or another lift from reception to the dining hall...

Breakfast was first rate, the rooms are perfectly adequate for a ski trip, the ski room is huge and the lockers warm your kit up! The hotel has two shuttle buses so be prepared to wait in the morning or get up early.

Spa has a small pool and only a few sun loungers so don't expect to get one but there is a well equipped fitness room, an excellent sauna and steam room and a set of showers with alternating hot and cold programs to help rejuvenate you after a day's skiing

The hotel is very Italian so much so the TV has no English channels and is situated 10mins walk from the town centre. This makes for a tranquil setting and perhaps not the place for those looking for late night drinking and atmosphere as it's also family oriented 

Yes I would recommend and stay here again

Title: Excellent staff and facility
Text: Staff was very attentive to our every need. Rooms and bathrooms are spacious and well appointed with great products in the bathroom. Views from the rooms and public areas are amazing. Hotel is on the edge of the town proper, therefore affording open views to the mountains. The spa facility is perfectly designed with a modern mountain feel. All the areas of the spa were well thought out. Lella at the spa was extremely friendly and helpful. I would definitely return.

Title: Fantastic staff
Text:
I stayed at this hotel for work in early September, I found a perfect welcome and organization.
Perfect rooms and with every comfort.
Special praise to the girls of the Spa: kind, professional and always very smiling.

Title: Simply spectacular!!!
Text:
I stayed at the hotel with my partner for a romantic weekend.
We found a clean and comfortable environment. Note of merit for the spa staff who immediately proved helpful and friendly giving us an afternoon of true relaxation.

Title: Excellent surprise
Text:
Excellent hotel within walking distance of downtown 
Upon your arrival max availability of receptionists.
In this regard, an applause goes to Front Office Manager Nando ... ke informed us of all that ke was needed x the stay and many other tips anke x the visit to the Mont Blanc skyway. 
In these high-level facilities, people make the difference, and here I found that attention and availability ke brings out the difference between the various locations.

Title: Far from our expectations!!!
Text:
We chose this 5 star hotel thinking we had a service to match instead we were totally disappointed with some services: spa service and reception service. The massage rooms are not soundproofed so you can hear all the noises coming from the pool and the mini gym a little 'poor.
The courtesy of the reception leaves much to be desired.
I hope our criticism can be constructive as the structure is very nice and it is a shame!!!

Title: Excellent
Text:
Highly recommended hotel. 
Perfect location 5 minutes walk from the center. Nice rooms with large and modern bathrooms. 
The shuttle service is really useful! A plus that not many hotels offer!! 
The staff is also very good, always smiling and always ready to help or recommend restaurants / activities etc. Special thanks to Wiam and Fatima for their availability and sympathy! 
Paola and Praneel

Title: Excellent
Text: We stayed several times in July and were very happy. Relatively new hotel, spacious rooms, friendly and helpful staff, especially the legendary Nando's. Very convenient shuttle service, also active in summer. Convenient location, a few minutes walk from the center.

Title: Never again! Not recommended. The stars are too many.
Text: We chose this property which was well advertised as a luxury hotel, reading rave reviews, which turned out to be imaginative and/or convenient in practice. Maintenance and cleaning are absolutely lacking. The staff is cobbled together and not very competent, being mainly made up of foreign kids who do not know the Italian language well. But even the Italians present do not industry to make the stay comfortable which is particularly expensive in relation to the 5-star claims. The structure is not equipped with blinds nor ‘abountiful, so’ at 6 am enters full light that wakes up; in the afternoon then entered a full sun that heated the room making the night unlivable for hot air; needless to say that there is no air conditioning, scandalous. We took advantage of the in-house restaurant La fourchette, which offers questionable cuisine and deficient lounge service. On the last day I tried early in the morning to book a table for dinner, which I was denied with peregrine justifications forcing us to make do elsewhere with the obvious difficulties of Ferrara. With oversized rooms there would be no room for two people. Spiteful vulgarity for the veiled complaints; the director himself, made aware, did not want to intervene with plastic disinterest in the difficulties of a customer in the mid-August period. And what about the TV, malfunctioning? On reporting the fault I was answered by the reception that I would have to wait the next day for verification. Absurd, especially in an alleged 5-star. However, no technician was seen, so much so that we had to make do. As for the advertised shuttle service, one of the drivers, a foreigner with rude manners, had to endure harassment. Finally, the breakfast service is mediocre both in the food offered and in the staff; they made us get up several times from the table chosen for their convenience. Departing, finally, from the hotel we do not find anything for breakfast because it was 7.20 am, that is ten minutes before the opening, despite having notified the reception the night before of the morning departure. Inhospitable, though very careful to load the accounts. I strongly and selflessly advise against staying at this hotel. They should give up at least two of the five-star claims and astronomical prices.

Title: Unforgettable hotel
Text: If anyone wants to take their head off and relax I recommend this hotel, well maintained great food, friendly and caring staff starting from Nando of the front office who cared about our well-being in structure and Cristiano who gave us great hiking tips, great breakfast and well stocked restaurant with quality dishes and polite qualified staff. The well maintained spa and very relaxing shame that these holidays have flown but then again when you are well and so, I hope to return this winter. Thank you all for this HOLIDAY

Title: Luxury relaxation in Courmayeur
Text: Beautiful hotel with a contemporary and refined design, cozy rooms and attention to every detail, professional staff, thoughtful and discreet. The hotel offers everything you could want for a very pleasant holiday. Special thanks to Nando from the front office for the attention he gave us and a special mention for the excellent breakfast overlooking the Giant's Tooth.

Title: Wonderful stay in Courmayeur
Text: We stayed at this beautiful hotel located in a lovely location in August during the summer holidays. Both the quality of the structure and the service offered are at the top. The staff welcomes you with kindness and attention to fulfill any request. Special thanks to the reception manager sig.Nando and the restaurant staff. We have been visiting Courmayeur for many years and have been won over by this holiday.

Title: Excellent level solution
Text:
I stayed for two nights with my family at this property which is located a few hundred meters outside the pedestrian center of Courmayeur.
We all had a great time. 
The structure is very nice and the rooms well furnished with a spectacular view of Mont Blanc. The staff and 'all very kind and considerate and was able to meet our every need.
Great breakfast and not discounted free parking in the garage.
For sure it will be our reference hotel in case of high stays in Courmayeur.

Title: Beautiful holiday
Text: My stay at this property was exceptional. We had a great time in the rooms and equally well about the relationship with the employees. In particular the manager was very welcoming and exquisite towards us. Ci torneremo sicuramente!

Title: Exceptional stay
Text: I had a great time in this hotel which is really flawless and exemplary throughout. From the rooms to the parsonal... All wonderful. The reception manager, Alessandro / Nando was attentive and helpful to our every need.

Title: Excellent experience
Text: We had a wonderful time in this hotel. There is nothing that has not been impeccable, especially regarding the attentive and thoughtful services from the staff. In particular it is worth mentioning the reception manager Alessandro/Nando who made our experience unforgettable.

Title: Mismanagement of manager by cockroaches
Text:
The appearance of cockroaches in the bathroom of our room. 
After saying it at the reception showing a picture, we had no communication so we asked again at reception 
All they told us was “that they had sent someone”
When we complained when we left, the manager argued that it was because it was “a hotel in the countryside”
Mismanagement of the manager

Title: To be repeated n
Text: Very kind and competent staff.  Great cleaning. The SPA is a bit small but very well maintained. The restaurant has excellent cuisine and the service is taken care of. I mention Caesar for advice on choosing wines. At reception Nando and Alessandro were efficient and helpful.

Title: Fabulous stay
Text:
We stayed from 22 to 27 July. 
I recommend this hotel for several reasons. We have a dog of over 40 kg and were welcomed wonderfully. The breakfast is fabulous and tasty, we chose to make it on the terrace with a breathtaking view. The great location a step fal center and the park next door super convenient for our dog. Very efficient and friendly staff, impeccable services. I would definitely repeat the stay at this hotel when we return to Courmayeur!!!
Important thanks Nando for recommending a fabulous excursion with Francesco dog educator of Giochi di Naso for a wonderful six-legged walk 🐾

Title: Posto meraviglioso!
Text: It is our first time in Courmayeur and this hotel was really a surprise. The rooms are clean and well appointed, the shuttle service to the center works well, all the staff is very helpful and kind. A special thanks to Nando who invited us to come back, maybe even in the winter season. His guys helped us get all the information we wanted. Great food at breakfast service. I would still suggest a spa service a little longer than the appointed time. For the rest, we look forward to returning.

Title: Good choice
Text: Good hotel, just outside the pedestrian area of Courmayeur, in a great position to arrive and park and to walk to the pedestrian center of the village. Very clean hotel, excellent and plentiful and varied breakfast, kind and full of information at the reception, employees in the dining room kind and nice. Very good spa , both for cleanliness and choice, very good girl of the spa. An applause to the receptionist who gave us very useful advice. To improve the level of the restaurant x à la carte dinners. However 100 x 100 Recommendation

Title: A hotel to dream
Text: Highly qualified friendly staff, high level cuisine with impeccable service, SPA immersed in a quiet atmosphere with panoramic views and welcoming staff always ready to fulfill every wish. Dream vacation we will definitely return.

Title: One step from heaven
Text: Wonderful hotel in one of the most beautiful mountain resorts in Italy. Very large room, spotless, warm and welcoming, with a characteristic terrace in the room, from which to admire the uncontaminated landscape overlooking it. Excellent service, indelible memories.

Title: What a nice “welcome back”
Text: I was here with my wife last year but the ownership and management changed this year. And the difference is noticeable, abysmal. First of all, Nando the receptionist welcomed us in an elegant and professional way, his boys are no less. Taste and quality of food as well as in the restaurant. Rooms with nice design and clean. I was more than satisfied. Highly Recommendation.

Title: Passing through
Text: I arrived passing by with some friends when we arrived at the hotel we had a friendly welcome Nando was fantastic in giving us all the hotel information!!!!!! Service .... Location .... logistics is all the staff we will return for sure the kitchen was delicious the room very clean!!

Title: professional and very friendly staff
Text:
We stayed in two superior rooms for 4 nights and had a great time: in addition to the usual expectations of a 5-star, we were very satisfied with the staff, professional and very friendly.
Fast check-in and out without problems.

Title: Our opinion after a short stay
Text: We had a great experience from various points of view. From the moment of reception we were immediately put at ease. All the staff proved immediately helpful and efficient. The well furnished and comfortable room, the restaurant that lives up to the expectations are part of our positive comment.  We did not have the opportunity to go to the spa and pool but those who went spoke very well.

Title: Esperienza irrinunciabile!
Text:
I found this place exquisite, not only in its extraordinary beauty care and cleanliness but also and above all in the professionalism and kindness of all the staff.
In particular I appreciated Nando's availability and Alessandro's great kindness and care at the reception, as well as the spa girls who hosted my son for the first time at the age of 14 in the spa with a welcome gift for his birthday.
What I appreciated most was the communication so friendly but professional confidential that puts all guests at ease.
Grand Hotel Courmayeur, truly an experience to be repeated as soon as possible!
For those interested in food breakfast offers an extraordinary buffet with top quality food and a cuisine with starred chef.

Title: Excellent Alpine hotel
Text:
Excellent hotel with Alpine style rooms and excellent views from the room's balcony.
We chose half board. The staff proved to be up to the quality of the hotel. Perfect with animals and a stone's throw from the center. We had a very good time and it will become our point of reference for our stays in the Aosta Valley.

Title: A 3 star for the price of a 5. Don't go!
Text:
What can I say: it's not a 5 star. You arrive and they barely carry your bags to your room. Where can we park? What time is breakfast? What services does the property offer? Of course, I don't expect great attention from a kid at the reception who has just graduated. Normal room, I've seen better in 4 stars. The first day they didn't come to make up the room.
Four of us had finished all the shower gel, no one came by to redo the room so I had to request it twice.
On the second day we were unable to go to the spa because access is limited and can only be accessed by reservation (we didn't know anything about it, my sister found out by chance).
Everyone abandons their cars in front and blocks the exit of regularly parked cars, so we ask how do we get out? Come back in half an hour. They provide a shuttle service to Dolonne, the shuttles of all the other hotels arrived but not theirs. I had to get on the phone and they had a random car arrive.

I laugh now when I discovered that I paid a little less for all this.

Title: A hotel dream
Text:
Our first holiday in Valle d'Aosta couldn't have gone better than this. thanks to the hotel staff and all the services offered, the stay was nothing short of magical.
Large rooms furnished with great taste, modernity that blends perfectly with the Alpine style. Comfortable beds and pillows of different softness. Huge bathroom, well structured, super soft and scented towels. In the room we had a spacious balcony overlooking the mountains (superlative!), with a small table and two seats. even the presence of the desk made it possible for us to do some office work even though we were on holiday, also thanks to the good wi-fi connection.
large TV, and good soundproofing of the rooms. electronic safe, minibar, spacious wardrobe.
bathrobe and slippers for the SPA available to guests.
only flaw: we definitely need to permanently eliminate the disposable plastic containers in the bathroom, and the absence of a kettle and cups in the room. for the rest nothing to say.

We opted for half board and I must say that there has never been a better choice than this. wanting to have a restful and sporting holiday, having dinner in the hotel every evening was a real convenience. Furthermore, the menu was changed every evening, which always gave us a wide selection of dishes. The chef is fabulous, the service impeccable, as is the breakfast: one of the best I've ever had.
Compliments in particular to the dining room staff: jovial and discreet, prepared and efficient. special thanks to Luca and Maria, who really gave us an excellent service.
Let's come to the SPA: not very large but ideal for post-ski relaxation. the swimming pool is heated, with hydromassage and neck massage. The sauna is small but has a beautiful window that allows you to look out at the mountains while you warm up.
The emotional showers and the Turkish bath are also beautiful.
if you are lucky enough not to run into rude guests who talk in a loud voice, or who occupy sunbeds with dirty towels after leaving, everything is truly fabulous.
A note of merit also to the girls at the SPA, who are very present to ensure that etiquette is respected and that guests' rest is guaranteed: the fact of having politely informed some guests that children are not allowed after a certain time in the pool it was a gesture that I greatly appreciated. Very good.
the presence of the SKI room also makes everything very functional for skiing: each guest has access to a locker that opens with a magnetic card, where they can place their boots, skis and poles. the cabinet is heated so TOP!
There is also a car park available to guests in front of the hotel entrance and a covered one which can be accessed with the room's magnetic card. here too, excellent service.

less than 10 minutes walk from the centre, but off the busiest roads, this hotel is truly magnificent.

Title: Optimal
Text:
Hotel that deserves 5 stars from all points of view: location, food, SPA, comfort but above all the kindness of everyone who works there. Thank you
I recommend the rooms overlooking the lawn where there are deckchairs and you can relax while seeing Mont Blanc

Title: Heaven on earth
Text:
A hotel worth more than 5 stars.
I spent a heavenly holiday in this magnificent place.
Everyone was welcoming, thoughtful and precise.
The rooms with Mont Blanc view, a work of art that nourishes your sight and soul.
The impeccable cuisine. All extraordinary.
I want to mention the director and the deputy directors, I want to mention Emanuele, Antonio and the Maître the chef whose names unfortunately I don't remember.
I'll definitely be there.
Well done everyone!
Freddy Battino

Title: SPA AT THE TOP
Text: I highly recommend trying the treatments with the manager Valentina inside the wellness center (open not only to hotel guests), in particular the Japanese kirei kobido facial which has an exceptional lifting result...seeing is believing!!!

Title: Piuttosto delusa
Text:
Inizio elencando i lati positivi..
La struttura è molto bella, in posizione perfetta perché appartata nel verde ma davvero vicina al centro raggiungibile in pochi minuti a piedi.
La camera mi è piaciuta..piccolina (era una confort) ma con spazi bene organizzati e vista stupenda sul Monte Bianco.
Arrivo ai lati negativi..
Abbiamo avuto un problema con il lavello della camera, a detta del personale è stato risolto cosa in realtà non veritiera..se il tecnico è stato mandato (come credo e spero) non ha risolto un bel nulla e il personale di turno non ha controllato.
Colazione inqualificabile... partiamo dal personale.. ragazzi molto giovani, direi gentili ma non hanno nessuna idea di cosa debbano fare lì dentro..sguardi spersi in attesa di essere chiamati per le bevande perché altrimenti non si presentano al tavolo.
Tostapane rotto..su due mattine entrambe non funzionante, poi fatto partire da uno dei ragazzi e poi di nuovo bloccato..in un 5 stelle?????
Un velo pietoso sulla qualità delle pietanze della colazione..nessun prodotto del territorio (fatta eccezione per lo yogurt in barattolo), succhi "chimici" , brioches surgelate della peggior qualità, torte dolci industriali, pochissima frutta fresca, il tutto servito in vetrinette di plastica per la maggior parte rotte..ma stiamo scherzando??? Un servizio così in una struttura 5 stelle per di più di montagna..non ho parole, non ci volevo credere.
Senza trascurare il fatto che il primo giorno ci siamo presentati nella sala alle 9.45 (colazione servita fino alle 10 con persone arrivate anche dopo di noi) e sui tavoli erano rimaste due fette di formaggio, una di prosciutto e un po' di frutta sciroppata.
Non mi è mai successo da nessun'altra parte, davvero.
Si percepisce la mancanza di una figura di esperienza che controlli ed insegni al personale come muoversi in un hotel di categoria
Peccato, manca tutto quello che è l'attenzione e la "coccola" per il cliente..dimenticavo.. prodotti da bagno presenti in camera di categoria bassissima.

Title: una vacanza da sogno
Text:
la nostra prima vacanza in Valle d'Aosta non poteva andare meglio di così. grazie allo staff dell'hotel e a tutti i servizi offerti, il soggiorno è stato a dir poco magico.
Camere ampie e arredate con grande gusto, la modernità che si sposa perfettamente con lo stile alpino. Letti comodi e cuscini di diverse morbidezze. Bagno enorme, ben strutturato, asciugamani super soffici e profumati. In camera avevamo un balcone vista monti (superlativo!) spazioso, con tavolino e due sede. anche la presenza della scrivania ci ha reso possibile anche fare qualche lavoro d'ufficio malgrado fossimo in ferie, anche grazie alla buona connessione wi-fi.
tv grande,  e buona insonorizzazione delle stanze. cassaforte elettronica, frigobar, armadio spazioso.
a disposizione degli ospiti accappatoio, ciabatte per la SPA.
unica pecca: bisogna decisamente eliminare definitivamente i contenitori monouso di plastica nel bagno, e l'assenza del bollitore e di tazze nella stanza. per il resto niente da dire.

Abbiamo optato per la mezza pensione e devo dire che mai scelta è stata migliore di questa. volendo fare una vacanza riposante e sportiva, avere la cena in hotel tutte le sere è stata una vera comodità. Inoltre il menù veniva cambiato ogni sera, il che ci dava sempre ampia selezione delle pietanze. Lo chef è favoloso, il servizio impeccabile, così come la colazione: una delle migliori che abbia mai fatto.
Complimenti in particolare al personale di sala: gioviale e discreto, preparato ed efficiente. un ringraziamento speciale a Luca e Maria, che ci hanno davvero reso un servizio eccellente.
Veniamo alla SPA: non grandissima ma l'ideale per il relax post sci. la piscina è riscaldata, con idromassaggio e massaggio cervicale. La sauna è piccola ma gode di una stupenda vetrata che ti permette di guardare le montagne mentre ti riscaldi.
belle anche le docce emozionali e il bagno turco.
se si ha la fortuna di non incappare in ospiti maleducati che parlano a voce alta, oppure che occupano lettini con gli asciugamani sporchi dopo essersene andati, è davvero tutto favoloso.
Una nota di merito anche alle ragazze della SPA, molto presenti a vigilare che sia rispettata l'etiquette, e che sia garantito il riposo degli ospiti: il fatto di aver segnalato con garbo ad alcuni ospiti che i bambini dopo un certo orario non sono ammessi in piscina è stato un gesto che ho molto apprezzato. Bravissime.
la presenza anche della SKI room rende tutto molto funzionale per lo sci: ogni ospite ha a disposizione un armadietto che si apre con una tessera magnetica, dove appoggiare gli scarponi, sci e bastoncini. l'armadietto è riscaldato quindi TOP!
a disposizione degli ospiti anche un parcheggio di fronte all'ingresso dell'hotel e uno coperto al quale si accede con la tessera magnetica della stanza. anche qui, ottimo servizio.

a meno di 10 minuti a piedi dal centro, ma fuori dalle strade più trafficate, questo hotel è davvero magnifico.

Title: Bello, ma …
Text:
Premesso che si tratta di un hotel 5 stelle, quindi il livello di servizi e facilities è senz’altro elevato. 
Diciamo che siamo stati sorpresi dalla “chiassosità” della spa e delle parti comuni. Sembra poco insonorizzato: alle 2 di notte, siamo stati svegliati da altri ospiti che raggiungevano la propria stanza nel nostro corridoio.
Anche in spa le voci sono un po’ “elevate” e basta ci sia qualche persona in più per avere un ambiente un po’ (tanto) rumoroso.

Title: Ottimo Hotel
Text:
Ho soggiornato lo scorso weekend in questo magnifico posto, compreso di spa.
Colazione ottima, pulizia ottima, personale gentilissimo e disponibile. 
Possibilità di massaggi in hotel. 
Io personalmente mi sono trovato benissimo con Valentina che mi ha trattato con il massaggio in maniera rilassante ed efficiente. 
Ci tornerò sicuramente.
Consigliato.

Title: Bell’hotel ma peccato per alcuni elementi
Text:
Ambiente moderno sia nelle parti comuni che nelle camere. Tutti gli spazi risultano perfettamente puliti, letto comodo e camere ben insonorizzate. 
Colazione ottima: cibo di qualità e sufficientemente vario. Ottimo servizio navetta per gli ospiti. Presente all’interno anche una piccola SPA (piccola piscina con idro, una sauna un bagno turco e due docce emozionali) 
Potrebbe ottenere il punteggio massimo se non fosse per alcuni “elementi” legati al personale, che non possono essere trascurati se pago 400 euro (e più) per una notte:
1) il personale delle navette (eccetto per il ragazzo in servizio il sabato 21 al mattino) è scortese e scocciato. Il sig che ci ha accompagnati al ristorante la sera ha manifestato molto apertamente il suo disappunto nel “doverci accompagnare” al ristorante, quasi si facesse un favore.. peccato sia un servizio compreso nel prezzo.

2) il personale della sala colazione assolutamente non in grado di gestire l’afflusso di persone (che per altro ad un certo punto si era creata una cosa di 15 min per accomodarsi ai tavoli). Ma passi la coda (che per altro non ha riguardato noi, ma ha creato discussioni e momenti di tensione) non è accettabile però che uno dei camerieri in sala (per altro il più anziano) inizi a imprecare e lanciare i tovaglioli sui tavoli vuoti, o faccia battute poco carine nei confronti di un bambino che piangeva in sala definendolo un disturbatore (“vi consiglio di sedervi in un altro tavolo così almeno non avete il disturbatore nelle orecchie”, tutto ciò davanti ai genitori del bambino, che erano increduli) 

3) sabato sera abbiamo avuto un problema tecnico in camera legato alla corrente e molto gentilmente dalla reception ci mandano in camera un addetto che entra seccato e senza neppure capire quale fosse il problema emette la sua “sentenza” ipotizzando che avessimo dispositivi Apple taroccati definendoli delle “cinesate” .. senza neppure guardare… ehhh?? 
Per fortuna poi la reception ci ha inviato su un altro addetto molto gentile.

Mi dispiace ma se prenoto una camera deluxe mi aspetto personale quanto meno cordiale come quello della reception. 

Peccato potrebbe davvero essere un hotel top se facessero attenzione ad alcuni componenti del personale.

Title: Hotel bellissimo, servizi non da 5 stelle
Text:
Hotel molto bello , in una magnifica zona a pochi passi dal centro. Ho apprezzato molto la SPA, i massaggi e il piano bar serale.
La junior suite è un po’ piccola per 4.
I servizi non sono assolutamente all’altezza di un 5 stelle.
Eravamo in 4 e avevamo solo un accappatoio.
La camera alcuni giorni veniva rifatta a metà’ pomeriggio.
Ci è capitato due volte che mancasse l’acqua mentre stavamo facendo il bagno.
25 euro al giorno per il cane per avere solo una ciotola di plastica. Il lettino promesso in sede di prenotazione non si è mai visto.
Un giorno rientrati dello sci abbiamo atteso un ora al freddo in mezzo alla strada prima di essere recuperati.
Un vero peccato perché la struttura merita davvero ma a quei prezzi mi sarei aspettata  un  servizio decisamente migliore.

Title: Laureata
Text: Struttura molto bella, personale carino , cibo ottimo, accoglienza alla spa ottima. La ragazza di nome Valentina molto preparata, professionale, gentile e disponibile a rispondere a domande di nutrizione. Massaggio super.

Title: Da non ripetere un caffè caro e mal
Text:
La posizione dell’albergo è eccezionale, gli spazi comuni molto fruibili, il personale inadeguato. Avevo provato ad agosto a bere un caffè al bar accessibile anche agli esterni, dopo aver atteso invano in reception  per 24 minuti di orologio senza che nessuno fosse in grado di indicarmi neppure dove fosse il bar ho desistito. Oggi 6 gennaio ci ho riprovato. Cortesemente ci hanno indicato il bar dove dopo essere riusciti ad ordinarlo velocemente abbiamo atteso un caffè palesemente n espresso per 23 minuti. Il caffè è stato preso al banco, mancava anche lo zucchero, il suo prezzo uno scandalo: 3 caffè euro 15,00 
La ricevuta di pagamento non indica che trattasi di 3 caffè..

Title: Vista meravigliosa, da migliorare il servizio
Text:
L’hotel è bello, la vista dalle stanze è bellissima e anche dalla sala della colazione.
La stanza spaziosa e anche il bagno.
Peccato però che non ci fosse acqua calda e il personale non ha saputo gestire l’emergenza. 
Per ben 3 volte sono venuti a mettere “le dita sotto l’acqua” per sincerarsi che effettivamente non ci fosse acqua calda. 
Tutto questo spalmato su 3 ore , lasciando passare il tempo , proprio nel momento in cui si rientra da una giornata di sport, e per andare a cena. 
Il personale non ha saputo assolutamente ne gestire la situazione, ne comunicare in maniera esaustiva e informativa i clienti.
In definitiva personale gentile e disponibile , ma incapace a gestire una struttura di alto livello. 

Dopo richiesta, è stato applicato uno sconto.

Title: Viaggio tra ciclisti
Text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per una gara ciclistica.Hotel belissimo e con molti spazi sia interni ,che esterni.Le camere sono spaziose e pulite.La colazione e abbondante e con molti prodotti locali.Servizio generale ottimo sotto tutti gli aspetti!!!Super consigliato!!

Title: Hotel deludente
Text: Non è assolutamente un hotel da 5 stelle, poiché vi è una grande diversità tra le camere, alcune non raggiungono nemmeno 2 stelle. Pur pagando più di 580€ per due notti, lamentandomi per la pessima camera ricevuta mi è stato risposto dalla direttrice che “quella camera ai suoi clienti non la danno ma solo per chi prenota tramite Booking”. Trovo alquanto ridicola e disdicevole tale affermazione, in quanto si afferma essere un hotel da 5 stelle e non dovrebbe avere così ampia distinzione tra le camere, poiché appunto anche la nostra, se pur di bassa categoria, aveva comunque un costo elevato. Inoltre la colazione era mediocre, sempre appunto molto sotto a uno standard da hotel 5 stelle.  Non lo consiglio.

Title: Quasi un 5 stelle...
Text:
L'hotel è nuovo, la struttura è moderna ma con richiami alla montagna grazie al grande impiego di legno. Diciamo che non è il classico hotel baita ma ha un arredamento più minimalista ma comunque caldo. La stanza era di buone dimensioni con un bagno grande e una vista sul Monte Bianco molto bella. 
Ottima anche la posizione perché è leggermente fuori dal centro e quindi dal caos ma in 5 minuti si può raggiungere la via principale a piedi. Ottimo il garage. Molto valida anche la SPA, non molto grande ma con tutto il necessario per rilassarsi dopo una giornata in montagna. Ottimi i massaggi.

Cosa non mi è piaciuto: La colazione è industriale con parte dolce senza alcun prodotto locale e tutto (dai cornetti alle torte) da grande distribuzione. 
In camera non c'era il bollitore e/o la macchinetta del caffè, cosa strana per un hotel a 5 stelle. Altra cosa ridicola è il costo dell'acqua del minibar in camera a ben 4€ per mezzo litro... Generalmente in hotel a 5 stelle l'acqua non è a pagamento o se lo è non certo a una cifra del genere. Ristorante e servizio non all'altezza di un 5 stelle.

Title: Bellissima camera vista montagna!
Text: Personale cordiale e disponile. Bellissima camera a due piani vista montagna. Stanze pulitissime. Comodità al 100% per posizione (a 2 minuti a piedi dalla via centrale del paese) parcheggio esterno gratuito. Molto apprezzati giochi per i bambini. Ricco buffet a colazione per soddisfare ogni gusto. Spa da non perdere! Super consigliato per un meraviglioso soggiorno in famiglia a Courmayeur.

Title: a due passi dal centro
Text: Hotel pulito e comodo, a due passi dal centro. La ns camera dava all'interno di un cortile ed era ben insonorizzata. Molto carina l'idea del soppalco con i due letti singoli dove hanno dormito i ns figli. Colazione business con alcuni prodotti del territorio, validi ed abbondanti. Gentilezza e cortesia del personale.

Title: 5 stelle di nome e di fatto..??
Text:
Staff e servizi offerti assolutamente perfetti, accoglienza ottima se si ha con sè un cane. Colazione con un gran bel buffet di qualità… 
Pulizia camera non proprio perfetta con qualche ragnatela qua e là, ahimè in un albergo a 5 stelle ci si aspetta forse sia tutto “perfetto”..Deludente” la struttura in sè per essere un 5 stelle…

Title: Grandissima delusione week end rovinato
Text: Siamo stati ospiti un week end, noi speravamo di poterci rilassare e riposare invece ci siamo trovati in una struttura dove venivano festeggiati due matrimoni, uno il venerdì è uno il sabato, quindi musica tutto il giorno e la sera compresa, Garage con macchine in seconda fila…, spazi comuni non vivibili, SPA con musica e speaker mentre il personale ci augurava un buon relax, sotto le finestre della camera schiamazzi vari, la colazione buona ma non andate vicino all’orario di chiusura perché molte cose non vengono rimpiazzate, camera e servizio non all’altezza di un cinque stelle. Abbiamo pagato sicuramente troppo per ciò che abbiamo usufruito. Non lo consiglio a nessuno.

Title: Bello, ma organizzazione da rivedere
Text: Soggiorno di 4 notti con la famiglia. Pro:struttura composta da chalet, molto bella, posizione fantastica, camere accoglienti, servizio ai piani(pulizia, rifacimento stanze) ottimo. Così così :spa piccola e ben curata, ma con forti limitazioni per l'accesso (se ci tenete molto chiedete bene prima come funziona). Aspetti da rivedere:colazione non in linea con un 5stelle,sia come servizio che come abbondanza e varietà del cibo. Ristorante :cibo servito molto buono, ma organizzazione del personale di sala inesistente.. È evidente la buona volontà di chi serve ai tavoli, ma davvero impreparati per un ristorante di livello.. lunghe attese, piatti portati al tavolo non in contemporanea, proposte per i bambini :"pasta in bianco o al ragù" e stop.Non ci siamo. Mi spiace per chi ci lavora perché si vede che ci mettono impegno, ma chi sta sopra deve davvero rivedere tanti aspetti. Siamo stati in strutture di alto livello in Alto Adige e la differenza si fa sentire.

Title: QUALCHE LUCE, MOLTE OMBRE
Text: Struttura nuova e piacevole, con una location proprio sotto le montagne. E' bella la struttura, anche se gli spazi sono stati distribuiti maluccio a mio avviso, ovvero zona reception grande ma senza alcuna intimità, spazi al piano di sopra poco fruibili etc. CAMERA bellissima, con boiserie in legno naturale grezzo, bagno enorme, bellissima cabina armadio (anche se poco funzionale in quanto non aveva il classico "apritrolley" e mancava di comodi cassetti per riporre le cose). Frigobar inesistente, così come lato caffè/tea (nessuna macchina presente, solo uno squallido bollitore pieno di calcare). Non avevamo inoltre la possibilità di avere coperte di peso differente e questo in un 5 stelle deve esserci. La camera prenotata con uno sconto proposto sul sito aveva parecchi difetti (forse per questo scontata?), tra cui la maniglia del terrazzo rimastaci in mano e come spiegherò sotto il problema della serratura della porta. Vista però da cartolina! Parcheggio sottostante bello, peccato che quello di fronte all'hotel non avesse le strisce per le divisioni dello spazio, con la conseguenza che clienti maleducati avevano potuto parcheggiare occupando due posti (sic!). Fin qui tuttavia solo luci, o quasi. Veniamo ora alle vere ombre: servizio reception pessimo, tutti stager, incapaci di gestire l'ospite e anche incapaci di parlare la lingua italiana (ma siamo in Italia, giusto?). La chiave che apre le camere NON FUNZIONA MAI. Ci è stato detto che per aprire la porta si deve spingerla o con il piede (sic!) oppure con la mano contemporaneamente. Vi assicuro che non solo siamo rimasti più volte al piano per alcuni minuti senza riuscire ad entrare, ma altre volte siamo dovuti addirittura scendere in reception dove ci siamo sentiti dire (come se fossimo scemi) che è normale aprire le camere in questo modo qui al Grand Hotel! Colazione: inesistente. Capisco che arrivare alle 9,45 possa dare fastidio ai camerieri di sala, ma NON TROVARE NULLA, dico nulla da mangiare in un 5 stelle è inaccettabile. Di conseguenza abbiamo optato per ordini a la carte e abbiamo scelto delle uova benedict (ovvero in camicia su pane tostato) con salmone o spinaci e la risposta è stata questa: "abbiamo appena aperto e non siamo equipaggiati per questo tipo di ordine". Ora mi chiedo. quali "equipment" ci vogliono per fare delle uova in camicia? Probabilmente anche allo chef disturbava cucinare alle 9,45 del mattino, quando la colazione stava per terminare....  Infine la SPA. Cartelli dappertutto segnalando che la SPA (come giusto che sia) è un luogo silenzioso di benessere e pertanto si richiede il rispetto di queste regole. Peccato che all'entrata della SPA non abbiamo mai incontrato nessuno che potesse far rispettare queste regole e come risultante la piscina riscaldata era stata trasformata nella "spiaggia" di famiglie con bambini (nelle SPA che ho frequentato in varie parti del mondo i bambini non posso nemmeno entrare proprio per rispettare la tranquillità dello spazio SPA), bambini piccoli che urlavano a squarciagola, bambini con i pannolini (sporchi) dentro la piscina, che entravano e uscivano dal solarium o che si tuffavano in continuazione su benestare dei genitori al seguito. Senza parole. Lo spazio della SPA inoltre è molto piccolo e quindi ogni tipo di schiamazzo si sentiva dappertutto. Meritano tuttavia parole di grande professionalità e abilità le professioniste dell'area massaggi dove abbiamo apprezzato molto il tempo trascorso nel rituale. Peccato perchè avrebbe potuto essere una mini vacanza indimenticabile.

Title: Ottima ospitalità
Text: Siamo arrivati di notte senza prenotazione, dopo aver ricevuto un'ottima accoglienza ci siamo fermati 3 giorni con il nostro labrador e abbiamo apprezzato la sistemazione sul retro con accesso diretto al prato. L'assistenza è stata rispondente in pieno alle aspettative, purtroppo però non abbiamo apprezzato né i piatti né il servizio del ristorante.

Title: Relax senza pensieri
Text:
Siamo stati due giorni in questo hotel immerso nella natura. Situato in una zona molto tranquilla e con vista fantastica. Personale molto cortese ed attento.
Camera semplice ma curata e pulita. Ristorante con prezzi da 5 stelle e servizio adeguato e gentile; Angelo, in sala, molto simpatico ed accogliente, ci ha fatto sentire a casa. (Ps. Ti aspettiamo ad Alba per la Fiera!)  
Qualche piccola incomprensione con il personale poi gentilmente risolta. Bilancio molto positivo. Grazie!

Title: Luci e ombre
Text: Camera gradevole in legno e pietra, non mi piacciono i corridoi, a tratti inquietanti, «shining style». La colazione ha un buffet incluso e alcuni piatti a pagamento, una cosa che non apprezzo. Cena accettabile ma nulla di straordinario (le melanzane alla parmigiana in Valle d’Aosta?), servizio pessimo, non all’altezza di un cinque stelle. Nell’insieme il giudizio non è negativo ma troppo “standard”.

Title: Piacevole weekend
Text: Bella struttura e buona posizione rispetto al centro, da rivedere a mio parere solo alcune comodità della camera (qualche disagio con il termostato e con la connessione internet). Personale giovane e molto cordiale.

Title: Non all’altezza di un 4 stelle
Text: Premesso che l’addetta alla spa e il cameriere del bar sono gentilissimi è che la spa è molto bella, questo Hotel a 4 stelle ne merita forse due. L’albergo è vecchio, ci hanno dato una camera microscopica e soffocante, il riscaldamento non si poteva abbassare, i materassi erano durissimi, il telefono della stanza non funzionava, il divano era inutilizzabile visto che era incastrato sotto il tetto spiovente, la doccia aveva la tenda e un soffione non degno di questo nome… tutto segnalato alla reception all’arrivo con richiesta di cambio stanza ma ignorato totalmente; la cosa più grave comunque è che al ristorante molto affollato il maitre indossava la mascherina molla che non copriva il naso e discuteva con i camerieri, cosa mai vista in un hotel a 4 stelle. Mai più.

Title: Un buon albergo, migliorabile
Text:
La premessa d'obbligo è, naturalmente, che si tratta di un cinque stelle dal quale, naturalmente, ci si aspetta qualità di livello.
La struttura è situata molto vicino al centro storico, che si raggiunge in 5 minuti a piedi; disponibile un ampio garage.
Architettura ed arredamento moderno, ben inserito nel contesto; buona la vista sulle montagne circostanti.
Al nostro arrivo ci viene offerto un upgrade gratuito, ovviamente molto gradito e veniamo conseguentemente accompagnati in un stanza veramente molto ampia; calda, ben arredata, con un balcone godibile.
Considerata la camera ( di quasi 40 mq) avrei preferito disporre di un TV (presente davanti al letto), anche nella zona salotto; incomprensibile il posizionamento di alcuni interruttori, come quello della cabina armadio, distante dall'accesso e che accende contestualmente anche la zona salotto.
Camera ben insonorizzata. Linea internet lentissima.
Consegnata incomprensibilmente una sola scheda di accesso.
Ampia la spa, nella quale tuttavia sarebbe opportuno un maggior controllo, in quanto come purtroppo spesso accade, alcuni ospiti non rispettano le regole (come le limitazioni di accesso alla sauna, causa covid).
Personale cordiale ma, troppo spesso, del tutto impreparato, forse per la (media) giovane età. L'addetta alla reception che non sapeva dove si trovasse la spa; un addetto al bar che ti dà del "tu" e che versa una quantità di rhum pari ad un sorso (letteralmente) per 12 euro o che porta una grappa al divano, con il bicchiere già riempito in mano (invece che bicchiere e bottiglia su un vassoio per poi versare in presenza del cliente); ecc.
Nulla di grave o imperdonabile, ma in un cinque stelle non è certamente opportuno, nonostante l'indubbia cordialità e disponibilità; manca, insomma, un pò di formazione.
Ci siamo trovati bene ed abbiamo gradito il soggiorno e proprio per questo è giusto sottolineare aspetti ampiamente migliorabili.
Colazione a buffet completa, almeno per i nostri gusti.
Pulizia ottima, così come il rifacimento della camera giornaliera.
Prezzi coerenti con l'offerta.

Title: Super consigliato!
Text: Non alloggiamo in hotel perchè abbiamo la casa vicino alla struttura. Abbiamo scelto il ristorante dell'hotel per il pranzo di Natale, atmosfera giusta, cibo molto buono e un super servizio di un cameriere sardo di nome Matteo, gentilissimo e preparatissimo nel suo lavoro. Esperienza molto positiva!

Title: Personale Pessimo,  da evitare
Text:
Esperienza pessima, arrivo con la mia famiglia alle 22, via telefono ci garantiscono una cena, ma all arrivo, ne il bar ne il  ristorante dell hotel sono disposti a servirci, dopo aver insistito ci danno 4 piatti con mozzarella, 3 fette di prosciutto e 4 calici di rosso (consigliati da loro )  speso 170€, prezzo fuori di testa😅 considerando che eravamo anche ospiti dell hotel per ben 2 notti con 2 camere. 
Personale scortese; sia durante il check in che durante il check out non ci hanno accolto e nemmeno salutato, guardavano in basso, come per evitare il nostro sguardo. 

Considerando che un 5 stelle dovrebbe servirti a qualsiasi ora del giorno. Che tristezza. 

Hotel tutto sommato Bello. Spa grande e parcheggio comodo, camere pulite e moderne 

Il cameriere Sardo e la segretaria in spa sono gli unici cortesi ed educati. 

Personale non degno di un hotel 5 stelle.

Title: Una certezza
Text: Premetto che viaggio molto spesso unitamente a mio marito in hotel di questo livello e devo complimentarmi con lo staff diretto dal Sig. Alessandro Urru molto professionale e gentile. La spa é ben organizzata e la piscina accogliente con acqua calda al punto di invogliarmi ad entrare senza fare le mie solite scenette perchè sono freddolosa. Il cucinato è ottimo ed a livello della struttura. Il rapporto qualità prezzo è rispettato e le camere di design molto accoglienti. Cosa si vuole di piu?😊

Title: Bene ma non benissimo...
Text:
Sulla struttura niente da ridire...davvero molto bella e perfettamente inserita nel contesto. Parcheggio comodo, personale gentile, tutto pulitissimo, vista spettacolare.
Il mio punteggio si abbassa però per queste voci:
- la spa: è molto carina ma...l'acqua era fredda! Poco più calda di quella di una piscina, questo non me lo aspettavo...le spa hanno sempre temperature sui 37-38 °C, qui era segnata a 33 °C e in effetti non mi ha scaldata, sono corsa nella sauna per cercare calore!
- il ristorante: non ho mai mangiato così poco in vita mia! Cervo e polenta in porzioni da scuola materna praticamente... peccato perché era buono, ma assurdo considerando la folle cifra spesa per uscire da lì affamati! Mi spiace non aver fatto una foto a testimonianza: tre forchettate e il piatto era finito. 
- attenzione Covid: alla reception mi sono trovata davanti una cliente francese senza mascherina. Nessuno le ha detto nulla: lei ha chiesto ciò di cui aveva bisogno alla receptionist e se n'è andata in giro in tranquillità per tutta la hall. Il cliente non ha sempre ragione, qui l'intervento era dovuto e legittimo!
Ci tengo a sottolineare che l'esperienza nel complesso è stata buona e spero che le mie osservazioni possano solo essere spunti di miglioramento: il potenziale è altissimo e non va vanificato, tutto qui.

Title: Molto bello
Text:
Hotel molto vicino al centro. Impatto visivo bellissimo, tipico di montagna. Personale molto attento e camere molto spaziose e pulite. 
La vista di cui gode è meravigliosa e i servizi di cui dispone sono diversi.
Peccato per la importanti limitazioni all'accesso di alcuni di questi servizi per i più piccoli.

Title: Un soggiorno da sogno
Text:
Abbiamo soggiornato presso questa splendida struttura in piena alta stagione ad agosto.
Up grade di benvenuto seguito da un pranzo veloce nonostante fossimo fuori orario limite.
Suite incantevole ,atmosfera sobria e soprattutto lo scenario del ghiacciaio che toglie il fiato.
Dietro tutto ciò l'attenzione per cliente che il Direttore Alessandro ha e  trasmette ai suoi collaboratori .c
Consigliatissimo a presto

Title: Servizi da 3 stelle
Text:
Per quello che costa  almeno una tv smart e un accoglienza migliore ci deve essere.
Se vi aspettate un 5 stelle di nome e di fatto ve lo sconsiglio, ci sono 4 stelle che sono di gran lunga migliori. Per quanto riguarda la struttura é molto bella.

Title: Ottima sistemazione
Text:
Hotel ben tenuto nel pieno centro di Courmayeur dalle aree comuni alle camere
Personale cortese e professionale
Ristorante non eccellente ma buono.
Da riprovare in stagione invernale con in atmosfera natalizia

Title: Ottima struttura
Text:
Io e mio marito abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel  in agosto  , con trattamento  di mezza pensione.
La struttura e' molto bella , moderna , funzionale e ben progettata .
Moltiisime vetrate consentono delle viste spettacolari  del Monte Bianco
Posizione ideale ,vicina al centro  .
Il personale e' disponibile , 
LE CAMERE sono molto curate.
IL RISTORANTE   offre  piatti di qualita'.
Rapporto qualita' prezzo  buono.
La Spa  e' di dimensioni contenute  , ma devo dire fruibile  con riservatezza.
Colazione ottima con vista meravigliosa
Nel complesso il giudizio  e' ottimo.

Title: Struttura nuova e curata ma servizio concierge da migliorare
Text:
Abbiamo alloggiato presso questa struttura sempre nel mese di Agosto. 
L’hotel è nuovo e le camere sono molto curate. La struttura offre inoltre un ottima vista del Monte Bianco, con un area colazione/ristorante vasta e panoramica. 
Unica pecca: il servizio concierge. Purtroppo per ben due volte abbiamo richiesto qualche informazione sulla zona in reception ricevendo informazioni parziali ed errate. Un peccato per un 5 stelle. 
A parte questo, il soggiorno è sempre stato molto piacevole.

Title: Una settimana davvero piacevole
Text:
Accolti e seguiti con cura ed attenzione, abbiamo trovato un ambiente cordiale e molto accogliente. 
Hotel raffinato e sobrio.
